Reviews:
Good old, classic Virtual Villagers. Nostalgia attack. | This is the best game I've played in my life. Red dead? NO. FNAF? NO. God of War? NO. Elden Ring? NO. None of these FAKE LOSER GARBAGE GAMES can even hold a CANDLE to the shining star that is Virtual Villagers: A New Hope. For starters, the visuals are perfect. They leave just enough to the interpretation of the viewer while still evoking a nostalgic feeling deep within your soul. The audio is delightful. I often say "hey" in the cadence of my villagers in day-to-day life. The lore runs so deep, Dark Souls has NOTHIN on this. I cannot recommend this game enough. It is truly the most perfect idle game EVER. Also, there is no language filter on your villagers names so you can have a bald 9-year-old named "COSTCO" or "WALMART" and no one bats an eye. Truly ethereal. | Great puzzles to tease your brain along with time and character management. I've played this before it was on Steam, great game overall. | I love this game! I grew up playing Virtual Villagers 3, so this is very nostalgic for me. 
I love the puzzles, the building and survival aspects of this game!

This game has one good thing going for it: the puzzles are truly excellent. Not too hard, no too easy, some really satisfying. But the rest of the game is all over the place. Voice acting is hit and miss, locations are usually really good, but the story is pretty nonsensical in a lot of respects. It starts off like a simple, detective-esque game, then it becomes very dark very fast (with things like [spoiler] on-screen cannibalism, burning someone alive and watching it decompose in front of you, seeing several dismembered dead bodies, and the aftermath of torture [/spoiler]; it definitely crossed more than a few lines for me), and yet it ends in an almost childish way, with an awful first cutscene for the final confrontation, and a desperate attempt at a cliffhanger for a sequel in a shorter, second cutscene). It also has a very weird mixture of christian lore and lovecraftian lore, which doesn't really make any sense (Lovecraft is all about cosmic horror, the feeling of dread and despair from being insignificant in a vast cosmos with beings far superior and knowledge that our mind couldn't even process; including a somewhat benevolent god who is "the god", and including other "gods" that are actually just "demons", even when being referenced as "gods", is nonsensical to say the least).
It definitely left me feeling disappointed more than a few times, and it overstayed its welcome for a few hours at the very least. I can't really recommend it. | I played it a long time ago. I really like it, that's why I bought it. 
Great game.

Plants vs. Zombies brings to mind the brilliant designers of the classic arcade games of the early 80's. Designers who, with access to scarily primitive hardware, scant complex controls, and often the singular player-controlled verb of "move," created iconic, immortal and wonderfully fun video games. Plants vs. Zombies is a game played with the mouse, and there are no exceptions made to this premise. There are no hotkeys, or alternate control schemes. It is a game your grandma could play, and I bet she'd like it. Also just like those old arcade games, Plants vs. Zombies, in its genius birthed of simplicity, comes to mind rapidly when considering what games are prime examples of art. Rest in Peace PopCap. | [h1]El juego de las plantas[/h1]
-uf sin comentarios, pvz es eterno
-arte: standar para una época
-jugabilidad: revoluciono el gaming
-música: tiene una girasol.... que canta
-dificultad: infantes con iphone en el bolsillo :v
-precio: vale cada centavo, aunque esta version de steam deja mucho que desear XD, malditasea steam! | 这里的游戏时长只有不到一个小时，但是它的具体时长我也无法得知，或许几百小时，又或许是上千小时，不论多少小时，也不论是否支持中文，都挡不住我为同年补票的心！ | 拥有超高英语水平，让我不需要汉化也能理解游戏内容，手放在鼠标上感觉像回到家一样自在，操作更是一气呵成，虽然有这么高的天赋但还是不考虑打职业 | this game was my childhood its hard fun cool and great animations one of my favs is the coffee bean animation i love to get the achievements but some of them like the yeti one or the grow 100 feet of the wisdom tree are just really one that was annoying was NO FUNGUS AMONG US that was hard but fun i really recomend this game.

Game Name: The Secret of Monkey Island: Special Edition
Reviews:
This is barely a positive recommendation.

The original game was great, and it's great that you can switch freely between them, because the remaster has issues. The interface of the original game felt dated when it came out, but worked okay. The remaster tries to update the interface, but with limited success - and in many cases the compromise between what a modern audience expects from an interface and the archaic old interface is downright worse than the old interface. It is often needlessly frustrating to play this game - the fight is with the interface to solve a puzzle you know conceptually how to do, and this is a terrible thing for any game, but especially a point and click adventure game.

It doesn't help that having played the game as a kid, and imagined what the pixelated graphics would look like - the update graphics often don't match my imagination of what the characters should look like.

But - the music is all spot on - as I remember the music rather than how the music actually was - and the voice acting is great. I've only found one or two characters so far that don't sound how I think they should sound.

What I want is to play the old game with the new music and the voice acting - but this will do. | I play this game once every 10 years or so on my best-of rotation. It definitely shows its age with the graphics and animation but mechanically it's very responsive and enjoyable. The story is great, the humor is classic, the music is peak nostalgia for me, and it's fun. | The Secret of Monkey Island is Adventure games at their finest. It's a all-time classic title for a reason. The writing is hilarious, the art and music are charming, and the puzzles are engaging. There isn't much to be said about the original title that hasn't been said already. However, this is the Special Edition, and I intend to review it as its own title.

The TSoM:SE is a very faithful rendition of the original. However, it clearly was designed as a console port more so than anything else. The control scheme is very controller-centric, which can take away from the experience for PC players. Of course, you can always hot-swap to the classic version, but then you miss out on the wonderful voice acting. If only there were a PC-centric control set as well, or even the option to have voice acting on the classic edition. | Remake de un título muy especial para mi, ya que se trata de mi primer videojuego de PC.
Gráficos y sonidos actualizados, dejando atrás los píxeles como puños y sutituyéndolos por gráficos dibujados a mano, pudiendo también escuchar por fin las voces de los protagonistas
Pese a tratarse de un excelente juego, guardando la esencia del original tanto en sus puzles como en su humor, reconozco que las mecánicas se han quedado un tanto obsoletas.
También comentar que ese juego que tantas buenas horas disfruté en mi juventud, apenas me ha durado 3 horas y media
 | Hilarious game with clever puzzles. Totally recommended. If you can beat it without hints then God bows down to you

Game Name: Time Gentlemen, Please! and Ben There, Dan That! Special Edition  Double Pack
Reviews:
Exzellente kleine Point & Clicks. Präsentation nicht das Gelbe vom Ei aber der Humor hat mich begeistert. | steam thinks i played these for almost 72 hours for some reason. 

10/10

Game Name: Time Gentlemen, Please! and Ben There, Dan That! Special Edition  Double Pack
Reviews: old old old school point and click. SCUMM style very stupid quite funny lots of day of the manic mansion, early Lucasart point and clicks. With all the pixial  hunting and strange logic. Sequel is the better of the two pack because better story but more frustrating Adventure game logic.
Je n'ai aucune idée de comment ce jeu médiocre est arrivé dans ma bibliothèque. (devait être packagé avec un album de U2)

Ich spiele das Spiel nun nach bestimmt 15 Jahren oder so zum zweiten Mal und wollte ein wenig in Erinnerungen schwelgen, und mich vergewissern, ob das Spiel auch wirklich so gut ist, wie ich es in Erinnerung habe. Und ja, ist es!

Klar, die Grafik ist heute nur noch mittel schön anzusehen, aber das hatte ich auch nach so viel Zeit nicht anders erwartet. 

Das Spiel kann (und sollte) auf jeden Fall in der deutschen Sprachversion gespielt werden (es ist ja auch im Original auf deutsch vertont worden). Es hat sowohl eine spannende, ernste Story (die am Ende vielleicht ein bisschen klischeehaft wird, aber das ist verzeihlich, denke ich), ist sich aber auch nie zu schade für einen Witz, oder eine Anspielung auf (deutsche) Popkultur. Die Sprecherinnen und Sprecher machen eine wirklich gute Arbeit (wobei man bei Nina manchmal das Gefühlt hat, sie ist doch etwas sehr locker und gelassen, bei allem was ihr so widerfährt :D). 

Ein paar Logiklücken hat man natürlich wie immer, vor allem dabei warum jeder auf der Welt, vom vereinsamten Indigenen im Wald, bis zum Pförtner am anderen Ende der Welt akzentfrei und perfekt deutsch spricht (oder soll man stattdessen annehmen, dass das jeweils nur für die Spieler übersetzt ist und Nina und Max dafür sämtliche Sprachen der Weltgeschichte perfekt beherrschen?). Aber naja, alles nur meckern auf hohem Niveau. 

Das Spiel macht Spaß und hat keine völlig absurden Rätsel. Es gibt eine integrierte Rätselhilfe für die Minigames und eine Hotspotanzeige, also alles was man braucht. Vielleicht wird man ein paar Mal einen Guide für die Details prüfen müssen, aber im Prinzip kommt man recht gut mit Logik und Rumprobieren durch. 

Ich kann mich an keine nervigen Sequenzen erinnern, oder irgendwas das mich grob gestört hätte.

Tipp: Auf jeden Fall die (Post)credits Scenes nicht verpassen. | I don't know what to think of this game, it starts off with really easy puzzles, but at some point the solutions become nonsensical. Last 1/3 of the game i was in a cycle of spending an hour to find a solution, then solving one puzzle, then wandering around again for another hour. All in all I manged to solve the game in 16 hours.

I was going to say this game holds up really well being from the turn of the millennium, but was surprised this game was released in 2006. Graphics and menus seem a bit dated for its time.

I guess since the game was good enough that I was motivated to finish it, I will give it a thumbs up. Not nearly as good as the Syberia series, but probably if you are a hardcore PnC fan and looking for something to play, get this at discount. | The story is very interesting, well-made and well-presented.

The puzzles tho.. really 50/50. Many of them make no sense imo and there were atleast 20 places were I would not have been able to progress on my own and only made it because I read a walkthrough.

That is also the reason that I will not play the 2nd game or any other of the 'Secret Files' - games.


I would give it a 6/10 (9/10 for the story). | Sorti en 2006, Secret Files: Tunguska reprend des idées rappelant Indiana Jones et les Aventuriers de l'Arche perdue comme point de départ. Nina Kalenkov découvre le bureau de son père, professeur émérite faisant des recherches dans la région de Tunguska, qui a été saccagé. Avec son ami Max, elle va parcourir le monde pour retrouver sa trace.
L'histoire est intéressante, et cette aventure à la Tintin se parcourt avec grand plaisir. Le jeu fut une très bonne surprise à une époque où le genre du point & click était quasiment mort, et il fait partie, selon moi, des classiques. Je l'ai refait plusieurs fois avec toujours autant de plaisir.

Muchos mods, pero con algunos mods es dificil pq tienes q jugar con una sola mano
 | The game also comes with a DLC, which includes the following items:

1. A Toxic Community: Mistakes are rarely forgiven. Unless you’re playing with friends, be prepared to face harsh criticism, often from younger players. The game’s multiplayer is largely populated by school-aged players who don’t hold back.


2. Disruptive Adults: It’s not just the kids causing chaos—some adults blast music through their microphones, assuming everyone else shares their taste. Spoiler: they don’t.


3. Frequent AFKs: Teamwork can fall apart when a teammate goes inactive, whether they’re brewing tea, taking a smoke break, or simply wandering off mid-game. And yes, it often happens right after you’ve generously used your first aid kit on them.


4. Team Abandonment: Lone wolves running off to the far corners of the map, only to be overwhelmed by infected, are a common sight. They’re quick to flood the chat with colorful language before rage-quitting the game.


5. Difficulty Disputes: Some players join games on "Expert" difficulty only to demand a downgrade. If their request is denied, they might sabotage the team before leaving the server entirely.


6. Vote Kicks: Occasionally, you’ll encounter players who inexplicably start a vote to kick you from the game. When you ask why? Crickets.



The Verdict: Despite the chaotic community, Left 4 Dead 2 remains a phenomenal experience. The graphics are a significant step up from the first game, the mechanics feel more polished, and there’s a greater variety of weapons and infected to enjoy. However, surviving the online experience without a calming remedy might be just as challenging as surviving the zombie apocalypse itself. | [h1]写了800字的推荐文，手欠点了一下"否"全没了。不说了血压高了,头晕。[/h1]总之就是《关于一个萌新GMOD玩久了无聊直接去玩L4D1多人因太菜反复被僵尸虐而被队友抛弃伤心自责卸载游戏过半年好奇进L4D2知道玩单人熟悉官图及玩法过程中发现了能打MOD结果一发不可收拾地搜各种进阶攻略教程提升自己游戏体验和能力努力不坑队友可仍然很菜但是很感谢带萌新入坑的朋友们以及创意工坊的大佬们给这游戏第二次生命的事》 | Крутая игра для игры с друзьями (которые в это не играют)! Есть редкие достижения, куча пушек и толпа зомби, которая будет медленно наступать на пятки и их съедать. В общем, весело, рекомендую. | Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2), released by Valve in 2009, is the gold standard for cooperative zombie shooters. Featuring intense survival gameplay, smart AI, and an incredible atmosphere, L4D2 delivers an unmatched multiplayer experience. With its fast-paced action, diverse weapons, and unpredictable enemy encounters, this game remains one of the most thrilling and replayable co-op shooters ever made.

Gameplay – Pure, Adrenaline-Fueled Action
L4D2 is all about co-op survival. You and three teammates must fight through hordes of the undead, navigating through various maps and completing objectives to reach safety. The key to survival? Teamwork, strategy, and adaptability.

The gunplay is tight and satisfying, with a wide selection of weapons including assault rifles, shotguns, SMGs, sniper rifles, and melee weapons like axes, katanas, and even frying pans! Every encounter feels dynamic, thanks to the AI Director, which adjusts the difficulty based on your team’s performance, ensuring no two playthroughs are ever the same.

Special Infected – Enemies That Keep You on Edge
Beyond the standard zombie horde, L4D2 introduces Special Infected that force players to work together:

Tank – A massive brute that can throw debris and crush survivors.
Witch – A terrifying enemy that, if startled, can instantly incapacitate a survivor.
Smoker – Uses a long tongue to drag players away from their team.
Hunter – A fast, agile infected that pounces on survivors and pins them down.
Boomer – Explodes in a shower of bile, attracting a massive horde.
Charger – Charges through groups, slamming a survivor into the ground.
Spitter – Creates pools of acid that deal heavy damage.
Each Special Infected forces different team strategies, making communication and positioning absolutely crucial.

Campaigns & Maps – A Horror Movie Experience
L4D2 features multiple campaigns, each set in diverse, apocalyptic locations across the southern U.S.:

Dead Center – A chaotic mall escape reminiscent of classic zombie films.
The Parish – A tense race across New Orleans to reach an evacuation zone.
Swamp Fever – A creepy, foggy swamp filled with infected dangers.
Hard Rain – A unique campaign featuring a devastating hurricane that changes the environment.
Dark Carnival – A fan-favorite, featuring a deadly amusement park with a thrilling rollercoaster finale.
Each campaign feels like a mini zombie movie, packed with cinematic set pieces, interactive environments, and intense finales.

Multiplayer & Game Modes – Endless Replayability
L4D2 offers several game modes that keep the action fresh:

Campaign Mode – Classic co-op survival through story-driven levels.
Versus Mode – One team plays as survivors, while the other controls the Special Infected.
Survival Mode – See how long you can last against endless waves of zombies.
Scavenge Mode – A competitive mode where teams race to collect fuel cans while being hunted.
Mutation Mode – Weekly game modifiers that add fun twists to gameplay.
Thanks to modding support and the Steam Workshop, the community has also created hundreds of custom maps, weapons, and campaigns, making L4D2’s replayability practically infinite.

Graphics & Sound – Immersive and Timeless
Even years after release, L4D2’s atmospheric lighting, detailed environments, and gruesome effects hold up well. Zombies react realistically to gunfire, and the sound design is masterful, with eerie background noises, terrifying growls from Special Infected, and intense musical cues that heighten the suspense.

The voice acting and character interactions bring the survivors to life, making them memorable and adding humor to the chaos.

Why Left 4 Dead 2 is a Must-Play
L4D2 is the perfect blend of action, horror, and co-op gameplay. Whether you’re playing with friends or AI teammates, the intense combat, unpredictable enemy encounters, and endless replayability make every match a thrilling adventure.

🔹 Final Rating: 10/10
Left 4 Dead 2 is a masterpiece of cooperative gaming. If you love zombies, action, and teamwork, this is an absolute must-play that still delivers endless fun and excitement after more than a decade.

Game Name: Broken Sword 2 - the Smoking Mirror: Remastered (2010)
Reviews:
I didn't play the original of this game, I missed it when it was free. 
I love P&N games especially older ones, but this one I could've gone without playing.

Maybe it's because this version of the game suffers from being a remaster, I wanted to like it but I just don't. Game originally came out in 1997 and they remastered it in 2010. Sometimes the original needs to be left alone.

I played Broken Sword 5 a few years ago as it was gifted to me and I really liked that game, so after that I decided to try to play more in the series.
Unfortunately this game was the second game in the series I tried and I didn't like it. 

I can see why people like this game, but it honestly wasn't for me.

I only finished the game for the achievements.

I had audio issues throughout the game, sometimes the voices were lower, and some of the cut scene videos wound up being really loud. I noticed that the speech would be in one ear, and in another instant it would be in the other.

While playing this game, I just wanted to push through it to get it over with, I played with a walk through to try to just go through the game as fast as possible. 

I decided to check out a bit of game play from the original version and I don't get why they made some of the changes they did. I preferred the way they did the speech (words above their heads) in the original over the way they did the remaster with the HD portraits. The inventory system was done much better too not sure why they changed that.

The game isn't bad, I just didn't enjoy it, I didn't care for the story either. | Saison 2 très captivante ! Bravo Georgie ;) | Pietra miliare del Punto e Clicca.
Parliamo davvero di un gioco, che ha fatto la storia. 
Il doppiaggio, la StoryBoard, le dinamiche, sono davvero incredibili..
Io lo definisco, un Comfort Game. 
Ci gioco e rigioco per piacere e per pura compagnia... <3 | These games are lots of fun! | un gioco che ho ritrovato ! spettacolare sempre

-геймдизайн. классическая квестовая серия скатилась в модный на то время 3д. ошибка.
~сюжет. продолжение детского детектива.
-графика. зря-зря. | First of all, the port is broken. When you start the game it will do that classic old-game thing where it changes your screen resolution, completely messing up your open windows (not the OS).

When you make any settings changes in the game, they don't save for the next time you run the game. 

Instead, what you have to do is go into the Steam folder, go to the game .exe and enter the properties. Navigate over to compatibility, tick the "Run this program in compatibility mode" and select "Windows XP (Service Pack 3)". Then you have to go to Steam and enter the game's properties in Steam; in “General” you go to Launch Options and type this in "-w [1920] -h [1080]" (or whatever your screen resolution is)

FINALLY, the game will launch in the correct resolution, and won't bork up your monitor(s). (You have to do that compatibility mode or else the steam property change won't do anything)

Now that we're finally done with this tedious process JUST to be able to comfortably play the game... you'll have to fix the audio and turn on the subtitles each time you launch the game, but at least this isn't as annoying as fixing your desktop every time you launch the game. If you have a PS1, just run an emulator. Skip the Steam version if you can.

Now, besides that—I really liked the writing. So far, this is my favourite Broken Sword game. Maybe the issue is that I wasn't familiar with the characters in the first game, so I wasn't as invested in what was happening. Therefore like in sequel movies, you already know all the characters, so you only need to enjoy the story instead. The second game... honestly, I don't remember it, it's like a fever dream to me: I remember having played it, and I wrote a review for it... but what happened? Did I enjoy it? Since it didn't leave an impression on me, I assume it wasn't good. 

But THIS! This game, I loved!

Now let me clear some things up. Part of why I loved it is because it has the charm of... objectively being bad. For example, the voice acting isn't that good... Like any time a character needs to exude some actual emotions besides simply chatting, this gives Trolls 2 vibes of "They're eating her. Then they're gonna eat me. Oh my gooooooood" And I love them for it! It's so soulful!

The controls are a bit... difficult. They're camera-dependent unless the character moves from one screen to another. So if you press “S” to move towards the camera, and then the character moves to a new scene where they appear on the right side of the screen, as long as you're still holding “S” the character will keep walking in the same continuous line: but from your perspective, they're now walking to the left instead of down. If you release “S” and then press it again, the character will start walking down again, instead of the "original direction" if that makes sense? 

Anyway, I'm telling you about the controls because it's important you know about 1 section in this game where the controls WILL mess you up in a time-sensitive section. To make a metaphor to avoid spoilers: Imagine you're playing Indiana Jones: Raiders of the Lost Ark. You're in the opening scene where you have to run from the rolling boulder. You press "S" thinking "I want Indy to run towards the camera, so I have to press downwards" But no, Indy runs "backwards" towards the boulder. Releasing “S” and pressing it again will make him run towards the camera—the desired direction— but because you moved towards the boulder for a mili-second, it’s enough to make you unable to escape it. I've tested: pressing "W", thinking "Indy is already facing the camera, so maybe pressing the forward key will make him walk towards the camera" but nope, he walks towards the boulder AS WELL! What you HAVE to do, is tap "A", making Indy turn left, THEN "S" to make him run towards the camera. That's how you "solve" this unintentional puzzle.

Speaking of Puzzles, the hint system is gone, including the 4th game (I don't have a favourable review for that bad boy). So unless you enjoyed solving the Goat puzzle without using Hints in the first game (I spent 3 hours before giving in and checking a Hint) you'll want to have an actual walkthrough guide open just to figure out what the puzzle even is. You'll see a bunch of crates standing about... but... why am I supposed to move them... like what is the destination? There are crates here that I can move, sure... but why do I WANT to move them? Capisce?

Like there was a climbable ledge that I didn't know could be climbed, so I didn't know what the puzzle wanted of me.

Closing remarks: 

Even though I have ALL these complaints: I really enjoyed the game. Despite this game making me mad at times: I loved this game! It's beautiful WITH its flaws!

Also Nico is tastefully hot in this game. | Ja is ganz nett. Kommt überhaupt nicht an die ersten zwei Teile ran. In keinster Weise. Aber viele Dialoge sind lustig. Ich empfehle es mal, weils so alt is. Ich hab mich gut unterhalten gefühlt, obwohl das Spiel ganz schön plump is. Is halt nen Kistenschiebesimulator.

One of those puzzle games, cute and cuddly on the outside, but with hardcore brain-metling levels by the end of the game.
The difficulty curve is quite smooth and balanced - levels in the middle are very pleasant to go through.

If I have to pick a problem with Toki Tori is that sometimes solution may include good exectution, and not just logic - but these cases are few and far between. And time-rewind mechanic makes is as un-annoying as possible.
bebeliğimin oyunu
крута гра
Weird, creepy point and click adventure/puzzle game that's better played with a guide.

Game Name: Agatha Christie: Evil Under The Sun
Reviews: No Reviews

Vzhledem k tomu, že právě na Hithitu probíhá kampaň na Posla Smrti: Pouto krve, tak jsem si zasteskla po něčem, co bude mít podobnou atmosféru. Alter Ego jsem sháněla dlouho, ale nikdy mě nenapadlo se podívat na steam. 
A tak jsem tady! 

Příběh dvou postav, jejíž osudy se protnou v jeden večer ve mně zanechaly poměrně rozporuplné pocity, jelikož konec asi není takový, jaký bych čekala. A o to celá hra byla lepší a zajímavější! 

Pro milovníky adventur bych řekla, že je to i nutnost zahrát.

Game Name: SEGA Mega Drive and Genesis Classics
Reviews:
Good emulator, terrible decision to delist it to bump up sonic sales | Of course they delisted it! That's what SEGA does. They make a compilation but only one press of it, then they make a new version for the next consoles but it's worse. Then they put the games on Steam and remove them because they're working on ANOTHER compilation, this time with an atrocious UI, and later remove that as well. Mark my words, Switch 2 is coming out for way more money than reasonable and SEGA mentioned wanting to revive some of their popular franchises, two of which have since been made better by other companies, two of which were tried previously and came out awful - they're not making AAA revisits of the greats, they're making WayForward vibe games for $40 each and will pump out another compilation. I want to be wrong and say they're gonna give us gold but it's SEGA. Trust me, I want this to age very poorly but, c'mon, we care about them more than they do about themselves. | For its time, I found it a fair exchange to legally purchase ROMs without any BS. Unfortunately there's not as much money in that compared to repackaging them or putting them behind a subscription service.

I respect the original concept but not the decision of delisting it to avoid competing with yourself. A similar sentiment towards the also delisted Dreamcast Collection. | Realmente queria jugar varios juegos de sega genesis en esta coleccion. Compre este juego en un pack hace mucho, pero lamentablemente, no lo instale cuando lo compre. Y ahora a la fecha del 2025, resulta que ni aunque tenga el juego en mi libreria, me sirve poder acceder a la biblioteca completa de los juegos de Genesis. 
Al menos en la Switch pude comprar la coleccion y esos juegos se mantendran. Pero en mi Steam Deck, la biblioteca que aparece en la interfaz del juego es desalentadora, solo 2 juegos DLC aparecen. Una perdida de tiempo total. | I bought this “collection “ before it was pulled from the store. Once I DL it and opened it there was only one game in the collection. Golden Axe. Am I missing something? I thought it had more than 50 games in this like the others.

Sconsiglio questa versione DIRECTORS CUT (possiedo il doppio cd originale che era stato allegato alla gazzetta dello sport quando ero ragazzino). Perchè? il gioco è stato tagliato di moltissimi punti di interesse sullo schermo che nel gioco originale si potevano visualizzare e osservare, contribuendo alla creazione dell'atmosfera e alla caratterizzazione di George.
La breve sottotrama che riguarda il passato di nico, per quanto interessante, si interrompe prima della metà del gioco, non venendo piu ripresa. Gli enigmi aggiuntivi sono carini.

In conclusione, dovendo scegliere, vi consiglio o la versione originale oppure l'ultima versione rimasterizzata, che in teoria non ha toccato alcun contenuto del gioco ma solo la veste grafica.

Parlando del gioco in se', una delle migliori avventure grafiche di sempre senza dubbio, trama molto bella e ambientazioni indimenticabili. CAPOLAVORO | Absoluta obra prima. Incompetent, arrogant, over inflated sense of self worth, and in dire need of American intervention to do anything properly.

Additionally, this game also has the same background as Assassin's Creed. Only difference is that this was written by someone with at least half a brain. | Сложно писать обзоры на величественные проекты, которые оказали огромное влияние на игровую индустрию, так как всегда есть шанс того, что ты что-то не заметишь, что-то упустишь из виду, а что-то и вовсе не поймешь. Сложно еще и по той причине, что к таким вещам стоит относиться всегда объективно, что порою бывает непросто, особенно если ты играл в эти игры будучи ребенком.

Но я, пожалуй, попробую это сделать. Ведь, к счастью, обзор мне придется писать на издание Director’s Cut обладающее массой спорных моментов, из-за которых данная версия "Сломанного Меча" воспринимается иначе. И, к сожалению, нельзя сказать, что эти изменения пошли игре на пользу, скорее наоборот, они лишь навредили ей.

Первое, на что вы обратите внимание – это перелопаченные анимационные катсцены. Некоторые из них просто зацензурили, где-то вырезали кровь, как например в ролике, в котором ирландский мальчишка рассказывает Джорджу Стоббарту о том, как киллер сбил на своем автомобиле несчастного Шона. А что-то так и вовсе было изменено. Как например вступительная заставка , с которой и начинается рассказ. Причем нововведения коснулись не только визуальной составляющей, но и монтажа. Во-первых, в некоторые из них добавили комиксойдные раскадровки, из-за которых эти заставки воспринимаются уже не как качественный мультфильм, нарисованный от руки, а как обычная игра. Во-вторых, монтаж был изменен в угоду добавленных сюжетных арок про Николь. И это очень сильно мешает восприятию ибо новый монтаж мешает повествованию, а комиксовые раскадровки перекрывают собою весомую долю экрана. В третьих, в целях цензуры некоторые сцены смерти нашего искателя приключений были вырезаны, как например момент, в котором саркофаг вместе с Стоббартом скидывают с моста в реку

Во-вторых, коли речь зашла про слона в посудной лавке, то нельзя не упомянуть и о нем. А именно о новых эпизодах про Николь. И проблема здесь не столько в самих новых эпизодах, которые по большей части хороши как историей, так и визуалом, сколько в том, как именно они были вплетены в общую канву сюжета. Дело в том, что первоначальный сценарий уже сам по себе был цельной, и в общем-то законченной повестью, которая не нуждалась в каких-то дополнениях. Во-вторых, главным персонажем данного творения является все-таки Джордж, а не Николь, и теперь складывается впечатление, что эта капризная барышня пытается перетянуть одеяло на себя. На пользу новому образу героини это не идет, так как она всего лишь персонаж второго плана, которая попросту поддерживает Джорджа. Делу еще мешает то, что разработчики совершенно не продумали то, как эти эпизоды добавить в сюжет, и когда повествование переключается на Николь, то нам просто на фоне черного текста предлагают посмотреть на то, а что же происходило с ней, в то время как наш авантюрист куролесил по всей Европе. Из-за этого история теперь не ощущается цельной, и это огромный недостаток. Но есть и еще один нюанс, который режет глаз. Дело в том, что оригинальная игра была полностью нарисована от руки, с использованием натуральных красок, что придает сему творению особую эстетику, однако же в новых эпизодах используется уже компьютерная палитра цветов, что лишь лишний раз подчеркивает их инородность. Стоит ли говорить о том, что из-за всего этого большая часть игроков невзлюбила эти изменения. И это печально, ведь если закрыть глаза на эти недостатки, то перед нами будет хорошая история, раскрывающая нам кто именно такая Николь, какие мотивы она преследует, почему она помогает Стоббарту, и что она не просто сидела сложа руки, а действительно помогала главному герою разобраться во всех хитросплетениях тамплиеров.

С этой проблемой разобрались, давайте же поговорим о другом аспекте, который нельзя оставить без внимания. А именно о комиксойдных раскадровках в самой игре. Во время диалогов персонажей в верхних углах экрана нам будут представлены маленькие окошка с лицами персонажей, которые принимают участие в беседе. И все бы хорошо если бы не одно маленькое "но". Они абсолютно статичны и лишь изредка меняются. И это не было бы проблемой если бы спрайты самих персонажей стояли с такими же каменными выражениями лиц. Но нет. Лица спрайтов полностью анимированы. Губы у них двигаются, эмоции меняются и персонажи реагируют не только на реплики, но и на то, что происходит вокруг них. Сказать, что от этого возникает ощущение зловещей долины, это не сказать ничего. В довесок к этому у этих комиксоидных вставок палитра цветов отличается от оригинальной, из-за чего они кажутся тут по попросту лишними.

Однако это мелкие недостатки. Есть косяки у этого переиздания и покрупнее. Дело в том, что часть комментариев Джорджа к различным вещам выкинули. А именно они подстегивали игрока исследовать местность, именно они раскрывали характер этого парня, его чувство юмора и способность находить плюсы даже в тех ситуациях, когда его жизнь висит на волоске от смерти. Из-за этого теперь не хочется так сильно изучать мир и возиться с вещами в попытке услышать от него анекдот, который на долго застрянет в твоей голове. Но мало этого, некоторые реплики были попросту переписаны. И в оригинальной игре, Джордж был острым на язык, но теперь он стал излишне саркастичным.

Однако если закрыть глаза на все это, то перед нами все еще хорошая игра, которая сохранила в себе большую часть достоинств. Помимо этого, в дополнение к этому переизданию вы можете бесплатно получить оригинальную игру, которая лишена всех этих недостатков. И именно по этой причине обзор мой положительный. Ознакомиться с режиссёрской версией стоит, но только после того, как вы сыграете в оригинал.
 | Medium-Easy difficult story with puzzles. Nice old adventure game. I love it when I played it twenty years ago.

This is has to be the worst designed point and click i ever played to this day. Story is your standard B-movie like mystical thriller, nothing special in that regard. VA are atrocious, listening to americans pretending to be french physically hurts. Narrative presentation is... also atrocious. Developers tried to create non linear game and failed hard. Often dialogs make no sense, as character start to blabber about things that did not happened at that moment or protagonist had no clue at that point of time. One of the characters works just like exposition machine. She exists simply to provide exposition dumps to protagonist, dumps that often should not even concerns him at that moment. Existence of such a character in the storyline is the best example of writers impotence.

Than we have puzzles... yeah... and its the worst part of the game, not because of moon logic or something like that, no. Because most of puzzles here are solved by tedious selection method. But thats not all this game from 2002 has... drum roll... A SOFT LOCK! Yep! You thought that by that time developers all over the globe realized that soft locks are bad, but apparently not blokes that created this steaming piece of something.

To the trashbin it goes! Thumb down.

PS: considering potential for soft lock, you may want to restart game... and there will wait an another surprise - unskipable dialogs! Because devs really, really wanted you to listen to their atrocious VA reading their atrocious nonsensical lines written in service of a story about evil wizard.

Legitimately a fun and unique setting for a game. Love the storyline and characters. | This one’s a solid follow-up to [i]The Blackwell Legacy[/i], offering another engaging, atmospheric entry in the series. I really appreciated the way it deepens the lore of the Blackwell universe while maintaining the same moody, ghostly charm that made the first game so compelling. Playing as Lauren Blackwell, a no-nonsense, chain-smoking medium, gives the story a fresh perspective, and her dynamic with Joey is just as entertaining as it was between Rosa and him.

That said, the game is noticeably short, even by indie adventure standards. The puzzles are logical and well-integrated into the story but tend to be on the easier side, making it a fairly brisk experience. While the writing, music, and atmosphere are all top-notch, I couldn’t help but wish there was a little more meat on the bones. Still, it’s a must-play for fans of the series, hopefully setting the stage for what’s to come.

[quote]I accidentally reviewed the wrong Blackwell, meant to write this under the first one, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/magerama/recommended/80330/]Legacy.[/url] Yeah, a review inside a review that both link to each other, call it Blackwell Inception. But whatever, all of them are great anyway. This one has less reviews, so maybe it's for the best![/quote]
I'm quite an elitist when it comes to point & clicks, but I think that even in the 90's when there was plenty of competition the series would stand out. I'm even inclined to claim that Blackwell would be considered a classic by now. Because it has it all: charismatic characters with believable motivations, clever puzzles with original tools for solving them, and great stories with satisfactory conclusions. Not to mention the games get progressively more beautiful. Although, in terms of looks, my personal favourite is Unbound, a prequel. If I had to be a stickler, I'd say that the voice acting quality is not always consistent and I personally didn't care much for the music, but these aren't even nitpicks, only half-relevant whims. The two main characters, Rosangela the medium and Joey Mallone, a 1920's ghost who guides her, get so thoughtfully fleshed-out throughout the series your relationship with them is going to feel almost intimate. Together you shall investigate dead people's back stories and send their stranded souls to a place where they belong, not necessarily Heaven or Hell. That part remains a bit of a mystery. Not because the writing is obtuse, just subtle.

But what really makes these games stand out is the inventive use of Joey's intangible nature (ghosts are the perfect eaves-droppers, who knew?) and Rosa's notebook for puzzle-solving. Normally in adventure games you can either talk on certain topics or use inventory items to achieve your goals. Here, the notes add another layer of complexity. You can ask characters about the stuff you documented or compare evidence by using your records on environmental hot spots. You'll see what I mean almost instantly if you give Blackwell a chance. I think everyone should. There were no bad games in the series, each one of them is full of heart and soul. I truly enjoyed the whole thing and make my recommendation without a shadow of a doubt. I wish I could be more thorough, however, I played a long time ago. Don't have any notes left. So, these impressions are a residue that stayed with me after many years since I touched Blackwell. Which is probably also telling. The games never left my mind, haunting my ass into writing this. And you don't even have to be interested in the paranormal to love them. I'm not. These are still among the best point-n-clicks ever made. If you're into the genre and you just found this goodness, congratulations. It's your lucky day.

[h1]Sobrevive a tus decisiones: un retrato de la muerte y la humanidad [/h1]
[u]Puntos Positivos:[/u]
[list]
    [*][b]Un apocalipsis con una carga emocional brutal:[/b] Más allá de los zombis, el verdadero terror del juego es la lucha por la humanidad. Cada decisión que tomes no solo afectará tu supervivencia, sino también la de tu grupo. El vínculo entre Lee y Clementine es la pieza fundamental  del juego, creando una de las historias más conmovedoras de todos los videojuegos que he probado.

    [*][b]Decisiones cruciales:[/b] Telltale logró que cada elección se sintiera importante. Desde diálogos tensos hasta momentos de vida o muerte, siempre estarás al borde de la incertidumbre. ¿A quién salvarás? ¿En quién confiarás? El juego te obliga a reflexionar sobre tus propias decisiones morales.

    [*][b]Personajes que se sienten vivos:[/b] Cada personaje tiene personalidad, motivaciones y un papel en la historia. No todos estarán de acuerdo contigo, y algunos recordarán tus decisiones para bien o para mal. No es solo un juego de zombis, es un juego de personas.

    [*][b]Banda sonora que te eriza la piel:[/b] Las actuaciones de voz están llenas de emoción, y la música acompaña perfectamente cada escena, intensificando la desesperación y la tristeza del apocalipsis.

    [*][b]Rejugabilidad con matices de horror:[/b] Aunque la historia tiene un camino general, tus elecciones pueden cambiar ciertos eventos, relaciones y reacciones. Esto hace que quieras volver a jugar para explorar diferentes posibilidades y cargar con el peso de nuevas decisiones.
[/list]

[u]Puntos Negativos:[/u]
[list]
    [*][b]Un estilo artístico con altibajos:[/b] El cel-shading le da un toque de cómic al juego, pero las animaciones pueden sentirse toscas en algunos momentos. En ciertas escenas, la falta de fluidez puede sacarte de la inmersión.

    [*][b]Libertad con paredes invisibles:[/b] El juego te vende la idea de que tus decisiones lo cambian todo, pero en algunos momentos el desenlace será el mismo sin importar lo que hagas. A veces se siente más como una ilusión de control.

    [*][b]Bugs mínimos[/b] Telltale tenía fama de problemas técnicos, y este juego no es la excepción. Desde caídas de rendimiento hasta errores en la carga de partidas, algunos problemas pueden afectar la experiencia.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

Si buscas una historia que te haga sentir, sufrir y cuestionarte, The Walking Dead 1 es una experiencia inolvidable. No es solo un juego, es un viaje emocional que deja cicatrices. A pesar de sus problemas técnicos, su narrativa y personajes lo convierten en un título imprescindible.

Quase 13 anos jogando esse jogo na pirataria e assistindo vários streamers/youtubers jogando, agora estou finalmente jogando twd oficialmente, não tem como esquecer do primeiro jogo que você chorou.
