 | Great narrator, excellent narrative weirdness, and a repetitive loop make this actually a lot of fun to just keep running around inside. | This is an interesting game. There's a narrator that tells the entire story. You have two choices; obey the narrator and follow the story, or disobey the narrator and create your own story. There are several endings you can choose from, and everything you do affects the story in a different way. Overall, this game has unique gameplay that's different than other games. | The narration/Narrator absolutely makes this game 

You'll spend the game going against the narrator, just so you can hear what he'll say about it.
For a game which is literally just walking around listening to a guy talk, its surprisingly engaging and amusing

Вторая часть оказалась куда лучше и интереснее первой, но без минусов в сюжетных моментах тоже не обошлось. Здесь я и правда сопереживала персонажам и мне хотелось поскорей узнать что будет дальше. И очевидно, что вся серия берет именно эмоциями, в первую очередь, потом уже сюжетом. Довольно хорошо, хоть и не идеал жанра. 9/10 | The Walking Dead: Season 2 is a fantastic follow-up to the first game, with Clementine stepping up as the main character. It’s incredible to see her grow and survive in such a harsh world, and playing as her makes every choice feel even heavier.

The new cast of characters has its ups and downs, not all of them hit as hard as the original group but there are plenty of moments that make you care about them. And just like the first game, nobody is safe, so the tension is always there. You never know who’s going to stick around or what your choices will lead to.

The story is emotional and brutal, just like you'd expect, with some seriously tough decisions. It also looks a bit better than Season 1, but what really stands out is the atmosphere. The bleak world feels even heavier now, and every little choice feels like it’s life or death.

If you liked the first game, this is definitely worth playing. It might not have the same emotional punch as meeting Lee and Clem for the first time, but it’s still an awesome, heartbreaking ride. By the end, you’ll probably feel drained but in a good way | Que temporada! A segunda temporada de The Walking Dead: Telltale Series complementa a primeira de forma brilhante, ainda que não alcance a mesma perfeição em alguns aspectos. Ainda assim, é inegável que se trata de uma obra-prima e, mais uma vez, digna de carregar o peso e a essência do nome The Walking Dead.

A narrativa é envolvente, me prendendo do início ao fim, capítulo por capítulo, sem conseguir parar. A Telltale mais uma vez entrega uma história rica em escolhas emocionantes e muitas vezes difíceis, que se mostram inevitáveis dentro do universo sombrio e cruel da franquia. Essas decisões não só testam a moralidade do jogador, mas também evidenciam o quanto a sobrevivência em um cenário apocalíptico é um verdadeiro fardo emocional.

O roteiro é intenso, os personagens continuam bem desenvolvidos e as reviravoltas mantêm o mesmo impacto devastador que se espera de uma boa história de The Walking Dead. Mesmo com algumas imperfeições, a temporada é uma experiência marcante que prova, mais uma vez, o talento da Telltale em criar narrativas interativas capazes de mexer profundamente com o jogador. | I really like this game, 2nd best game of the series 8/10
I dont have much to say because the choices you'll have in the ending are both sad and full of uncertainty | Though not as good as the first game, The Walking Dead Season Two is still a very good story about the bleakness of life during a zombie apocalypse. You pick up slightly where you left off in the first game with the story molding to how you played or choices you made in the first game, which is a freaking cool thing. 
Without spoiling the story, you're going to have a lot more emotional lows playing this one. but hey that's realistic. 
Team Kenny All Da Way.

Jogo divertido, só que a IA dele frustra e MUITO a experiência por ser uma IA burra e ao invés de te desafiar, te faz passar raiva.

Also a notable "one more turn" example. Simple, fast, not punishing, not demanding.

Playable with mouse only, so can be played fine from phone + steam link, and works fine with native touch screens too. | Ein gutes  und strategisches Kartenspiel zu einem guten Preis. | Great fun!

$2.99? I bought this game not expecting much from it. And now it's 2am in the morning. Low price for hours of fun, where a pizza costs more and lasts 5 minutes? I recommend this game for people that enjoy tower simulation games :) very well made. | At the moment I'm some 5.5 hours into the game. Turns out it's not really a "simulation" nor a "strategy" game (as implied by the Steam tags) but a "click-and-wait" game. Luckily I got it at a decent discount. 

The premise is promising and could make for a very interesting game. Thus it's a real shame it's almost not a game at all. Your business runs on its own and you just have to keep adding new rooms and people when you have the money -- and usually you don't have the money, so most of your time is spent waiting for money to accumulate. There's also not much to stop the money from accumulating, except for the random message dialogs that randomly pop up and require you to click "OK". The game is literally unable to advance a single in-game day without you being present clicking something. Forget about SimCity and the like where you could leave the game to run for an hour and come back. This game runs a minute or two and after that it need you to click a button.

Building a new room into your call center costs $3000 or more. At least in the beginning (for the first couple of hours) you won't make more than a few hundred dollars a day, so you wait. And wait. And wait. Occasionally someone quits and you need to replace him or her, and that of course takes away from the small pile of money you had accumulated.

Upgrading rooms costs $5000 or more, so your money seems much more well spent just adding rooms than upgrading them. Or at least I think so. The game lacks proper statistics so it's difficult to get an overview of your situation. Sure, you can read the thoughts of all of your employees and you can see a list of your clients (up to a whopping number of two (2) within my first 5.5 hours, or two in-game months), and you can click on all of your rooms and get to know some stats about them. But there's no list of rooms, or heat maps of any kind. There is a list of employees, but it appears that you cannot sort it, and the filter system (for choosing which types of employees you want to see) is really clumsy, requiring multiple clicks on a different screen from the actual list! So while you can get the details of a detail, there's no real big picture available.

Talking about your employees, you can hire different kind of people: inbound (IB) agents to receive calls, outbound (OB) agents to make calls, managers, janitors, etc. The different professions are very stereotypical. They might've been true in the 1960s or funny in the 1990s, but seriously, it's 2016 now. When a manager's work description is "putting fear in the agents" and you see him running around and shouting at people, I don't even. Similarly, a "Coach" turned out to be a cheerleader girl waving pom-poms. Seriously?? 

You can also educate your employees (just a click of a button and ta-dah, they are instantly smarter!). The education levels are very sketchy too, like a manager learning a class "Management By Fear" or another person learning "Lying 101".

Yet another profession is the Project Manager. They unlock new things for you to do. However, you cannot decide what, so most of the time they unlock the possibility of building an even taller building (10 floors, 15 floors, ..., 50 floors, ...) when your building is still less than 5 floors tall and you'd much rather have, say, some better education levels or some new room types. (Not that it'd matter, you wouldn't have the money to buy those things anyway, until after waiting for quite some time.)

All in all this game seems to waste its potential really badly. It's not a game that you play intensively, but a game that you put into the background or on your second screen while facebooking or something, and just check out occasionally to click "OK" on that dialog. I believe I'll still give this game a chance for a couple of more hours to see if the money would start pouring in a little faster and if that would make it funnier, but I have my doubts. | Cost of Game/Time Spent Playing easily makes this one of the best deals you will find on Steam. I've had a lot of fun experimenting with different layouts and mixes of employees. If you like tower builders or business simulators, it's a fun light hearted game that will keep you challenged the whole way through. How high can you build before the nearly unescapable death spiral brings you crashing back down? Easy to pause and save at pretty much any point in the game, which is great for someone like myself who usually plays turn based strategy games or slower city building games.

Computer techs kicking computers until they start working again is quite possibly the best example of IT work I've ever seen in a video game. Watching managers storm around freaking out for no reason will make any call center, retail, or food service worker feel right at home.

This is one of those ones you buy that make you angry you spent $60 on some AAA title you got bored of in 20 minutes. | + Casual fun
+ Plenty to unlock and play with
+ Addictive

+/- Controls don't always make sense, lots of misclicking/unintuitive clicking
+/- Time ocassionally moves too slowly (even on the fastest speed)
+/- Stuff can cost a lot of money

- Unlocking things takes too much time
- Too much micromanaging 10> virtual days into the game
- I couldn't find a way to generate any more money once you get less and less income (mainly because of people quiting because their PC is broken (among other things) and IT guys quiting because they can't keep up = endless loop)

[Rating: 75/100] | If you have ever worked in a call center, this game may bring back those horrible memories (especially if you were a supervisor and had to deal with those awful productivity reports LOL), but this is a fun and unique building game in the same vein as SimTower.  You have to make sure you have enough agents to answer the call volumes of the contracts you choose to accept and you must keep those agents happy and productive.

PROS

CONS

- Satisfying contracts AND your staff can be tough

Ein schönes Spiel wie in der Vergangenheit :) Wer die alten Adventure mag, kann hier nichts falsch mach | Broken Sword es una saga bastante consagrada dentro de la industria, un nombre pesado que significa mucho para las aventuras gráficas y cuya calidad global es indiscutible. Sin embargo, también es innegable que su evolución no ha sido la más afortunada, por lo que esta quinta entrega tenía la gran responsabilidad de devolverle la gloria al nombre de la saga que porta, y su resultado final no pudo haber sido más placentero incluso con sus fallitos.

Una vez más, el intrépido George Stobbart y la astuta Nicole Collard serán los protagonistas de esta nueva aventura, alejándose del experimento que hizo la cuarta entrega en poner a un desaprovechado tercer protagonista que comprometía la integridad del dúo principal. Como viene siendo costumbre en la saga, la trama arrancará con los protagonistas viéndose envueltos en contra de su voluntad en todo un complot a nivel mundial, mezclando ficción y realidad creativamente y esta vez girando en torno al misterio de “La Maldición de la Serpiente”, como bien hace referencia el título.

Uno de los puntos más fuertes de Broken Sword 5, así como del resto de entregas, es que su esencia se mantiene intacta a través de su estilo tan característico a la hora de desarrollar lenta e inexorablemente su trama, sabiendo manejar de forma notable su comedia hilarante con sus momentos más serios, destacando en que la química entre George y Nicole se siente tal y como en la primera entrega, resultando familiares y añejos desde el principio hasta el final. Además de ellos, “The Serpent's Curse” trae de vuelta a viejos conocidos a lo largo de la pentalogía, personajes que bien han podido pasar uno o varios juegos de ausencia total, y sin embargo verlos aquí reunidos manteniendo su personalidad intacta, además de darles un papel a cumplir para con la trama, resulta en un ejemplo de fanservice bien realizado. Y es que haber recuperado su estilo 2D aun conservando efectos en 3D, luciendo unos paisajes hermosos y recreando otros ya conocidos, así como haber recuperado al compositor de los dos primeros juegos hacen sentir a esta quinta entrega más en sintonía con sus orígenes que “The Sleeping Dragon” y “The Angel of Death”.

No obstante, esto acarrea también un problema que tiene no esta entrega en concreto, sino la saga a nivel general, y es una carencia de retroalimentación entre sus tramas. Poniéndonos en contexto, mientras que los Broken Sword 1, 3 y 4 conformaban una especie de trilogía al seguir todos la trama de los templarios, el 2 y el 5 tiran más por contar una narrativa propia, con puntuales referencias a momentos vividos con anterioridad, aunque sintiéndose una cierta desconexión a lo largo de la pentalogía que da la sensación de que cada título se queda en su propia burbuja en vez de formar todos en comunión una narrativa más global y cohesionada.

El motivo por el cual esto llama tanto la atención se comprende mejor al analizar al dúo protagónico; tanto Nicole como George han tenido una evolución nula a lo largo de la saga, quedando cualquier vestigio dentro de cada juego pero reiniciándose sus personalidades con el pasar de las entregas, lo cual acarrea el riesgo de hacerlos parecer planos y estancados en sus pocos rasgos distintivos. Cada título hace referencia a lo que le interesa, ignorando detalles bastante importantes como todo el asunto de George volviéndose un héroe al final del 3, o Nicole al evitar que el mal se esparciera en “The Smoking Mirror”. Y es que ver a estos dos, que ya han pasado por muchas aventuras destapando en más de una ocasión conspiraciones secretas de índole mundial, e incluso enfrentándose a criaturas de fantasía como un dragón malévolo o el espíritu de un demonio, verlos ahora reaccionar con tanta incredulidad ante el misterio de la quinta entrega cuando deberían estar ya sobradamente curtidos en esta clase de situaciones, se siente como un enorme paso atrás en todo sentido.

De todas formas, a pesar de este problema que la saga lleva arrastrando desde su segunda entrega, la trama sigue siendo tan entretenida e intrigante como de costumbre, lo que evita que resulte aburrida. No llega a resultar tan bien escrita y memorable como el primer juego ni alcanza el nivel de epicidad del tercero, pero definitivamente supera al cuarto e incluso ligeramente al segundo, siendo de las historias más interesantes de la franquicia.

Y sacando músculo en lo que esta saga siempre ha sabido hacer bien, los puzzles relucen más que nunca en la quinta entrega, posicionándose como una de las de mayor calidad en ese sentido. Es cierto que la joya de la corona la ostenta el 4 a pesar de su flojísima trama, dejando al 1 como el más equilibrado mientras que el 2 quedaría un poco por debajo y el 3 en el más fácil. El 5 sabe recoger un poco de todo lo bueno de cada entrega, siendo así el más variado en el tema de sus rompecabezas, sin llegar al nivel altísimo del 4 aunque no quedándose lejos, y resultando en una aventura gráfica muy desafiante y gratificante de superar.

A modo de contenido extra, el juego también ofrece un par de detalles interesantes: el famoso sistema de pistas incluido en las versiones remasterizadas de los dos primeros juegos, y una galería de personajes que relata su biografía junto a un modelado de los mismos. Ambos elementos son muy llamativos, pero lastimosamente terminan siendo más un lastre y una decepción respectivamente que algo positivo. El sistema de pistas, totalmente opcional, sigue sufriendo del mismo fallo de diseño en el cual si estamos en una habitación con distintas tareas, dependiendo del orden en que interactuemos con ellas, las pistas para un determinado puzzle pueden solaparse con el de otro, haciendo que este sistema resulte inútil en ocasiones al no poder retroceder si nos hemos adelantado, lo cual es muy común. Además, dicha galería, aunque es un elemento novedoso e interesante, está desaprovechada; diese la sensación de que fue incluida al principio del desarrollo pero se cortó a la mitad, de lo contrario no tendría explicación que personajes terciarios, cuya participación e importancia es mínima, aparezcan en la galería mientras que otros personajes mucho más importantes que se introducen a posteriori en la trama no se les den su correspondiente espacio, acabando con ser una idea a medio desarrollar y dejada sin propósito.

Pareciera ser que Revolution buscó con creces revitalizar el nombre de la saga con esta quinta entrega mucho más reminiscente a las dos primeras sin dejar de aprender del camino recorrido por los dos denostados títulos anteriores, y lo logró con creces. Es un juego bastante sólido tanto en lo técnico como, especialmente, en sus rompecabezas. Si bien su problema de cohesión narrativa con el resto de los juegos persiste y no parece que vaya a cambiar nunca, además de reducir a sus dos protagonistas a meros maniquíes sin desarrollo, su narrativa sigue siendo intrigante y tiene todos los elementos intactos que hacen tan reconocible a Broken Sword. Es una quinta entrega que vuelve a subir el listón de la franquicia por todo lo alto y una aventura tan entretenida como desafiante, de modo que sólo queda esperar a ver cómo harán los chicos de Revolution para mantener a flote su IP más preciada en el futuro. | mamma mia questo gioco!!! sono una divoratrice di avventure grafiche ma sono molto schizzinosa, e mi piace solo roba di alta qualità... questo come moltissimi altri giochi vecchi che sono poi tornati in voga è più di un gioco.. è come stare in famiglia... non smetterei mai di giocare a giochi così belli, la grafica è eccezionale, la caratterizzazione dei personaggi fantastica e divertente, l'ho adorato dall'inizio alla fine.... vi prego fatene ancora! | I haven't given up this game yet but I think I am close to it. Liked:
Good fun game with lots of intrigue and a good plot.
Loved the creativity in the portals going to different scenes.
Loved the play on time, probably best part of the game.
The puzzles were generally good, some easy some harder and more complex.

Disliked:
I spent too much time on a key puzzle which was, in my opinion, illogical.  I think those who have played know which one that is.  It’s Drake’s closet puzzle.  Without giving it away, think about it, developers should know that the birth dates would not be relative to the keepers’ disappearance date but more likely to the date Drake got his promotion and moved into his room, i.e., 1907.  And even then, the puzzle is still obtuse…

The point and click has had its days.

Thumbs up, but definitely not a perfect game. The episodes themselves are fine, story and voice acting seems like proper Doctor Who episodes. Sadly the game has a few impractical things in it, low graphics and a few bugs. The mouse seems laggy in the buzzer game puzzle, which is pretty annoying. I also feel they overdid the stealth thing a bit; there's a lot of it. The music is great, ofcourse, the game uses the music from the tv show.

The sound in this game really bugged me; the voices did not seem to come from the characters properly and it didn't sound like the voices came from the place the character was; they sounded like they were in a sound studio (which they probably were) and whoever managed sound didn't do a good enough job to put the voices in their proper setting. The sound effects are also off; knocks on doors, for example, is randomly played and does not match the characters hand hitting the door. In the last episode, for some reason,; probably supposed to sound like wind or water; the sound sounded like a crap microphone sound over skype, like someone put their volume on too high and didn't speak, but the mic kept running. 

The game has a fairly low quality on the graphics, but most characters have a good likeness, with the exception, I feel, of Rory, who looks rather bland and not too recognisable. Amy's face makes her look 12, which is an awkward mix with her short skirt and the whole being married thing.

I experienced a few bugs; in one episodes it's possible to fall into the water, but you spawn on the harbour again almost instantly so no harm done. Another bug I had was starting the game from the main menu into a particular savepoint where there is a puzzle with lasers spawning in hallways that are timed and you have to move between corridors to dodge them. For some reason when spawning into this savespot from the menu one laser was on all the time and the other lasers never showed. "Fixed" by suicide, but annoying again. I also had a few times npcs would get stuck; mostly random npcs wandering around, but at one point an enemy as part of a stealth puzzle (made it easier so I shan't complain too much), but most annoying; when you are in a stealth puzzle and have a companion with you, your dumbarse partner has a chance of getting stuck and if you're reeeeally unlucky they will get stuck in a point where they are found by an enemy and killified and you have to start over.

Another impractical things; you cannot see your collection from the main menu in the main episodes; you have to quit to the menu to see it. 
The game has 2 options when opening it; either run the first 4 episodes or the longer Gunpowder episode. The first 3 episodes has 3 acts and when you have completed it you can start in any act, which is nice if you forgot a collection item. For some reason the Gunpowder episodes does not have this option and you have to start over from the beginning of the episode if you missed something. 

Is it for fans only? Probably yes; as with all the bugs and minor nuisances you can probably find a better game in the genre. Most episodes have enemies already seen in the Doctor Who universe, but nothing a newbie can't handle, with the exception of episode "Tardis" where you get a quiz about some things from the show (even from pre-2005). Nothing google can't fix and the questions don't change should you fail and have to try again, so you can always guess your way through.

Overall a decent game if you want to feel part of a Doctor Who episode or five, but not the best game for its genre and a non-fan should probably look elsewhere for p&c adventure.

    İşte karşımızda Steam'deki bir başka Doctor Who oyunu. Bu oyun, Eternity Clock'a nazaran diziye daha yakın gitmiş. Oynarken bir yandan da Doctor Who'nun bir bölümünü izliyormuş hissiyatı veriyor. Genel olarak baktığımızda, yine birbirinden farklı bulmacalar ve etkileşimlerdeki küçük oyunlar var.

   Oyun toplamda 5 bölümden oluşmakta. Normal dizinin beş bölümü gibi düşünebilirsiniz bu bölümleri. Dalekler, Cybermanler ve birbirinden ilginç diğer uzaylı kardeşlerimiz.

   Oyunda oynanabilir 3 karakter var, oyunun içerisindeki 4 bölümde Doctor ve Amy, ve sonradan eklenen bölüm olan "The Gunpowder Plot"da Doctor, Amy ve Rory.

   Oyunun asıl 4 bölümü dediğim kısımda kartlar topluyoruz aynı zamanda. Şimdiye kadarki Doktorlar, Companionlar, Enemyler diye gidiyor bu liste. Ve yine tüm bölümlerde çeşitli artifactler toplayarak, çevre hakkında ve dönemin yaşayışı hakkında da bilgi edinebilirsiniz.

   Oynanabilirlik açısından baktığımızda ilk 4 bölümü-ki önemli olan kısım burası- bugla ya da kötü fiziklerle karşılaşmadan, saç baş yolmadan bitirebiliyoruz. Ama çok umutla, merak ederek başladığım "The Gunpowder Plot"da işler değişiyor. Adeta farklı bir fizik anlayışı kullanılmış, sanki farklı bir oyunun içine girmişiz. Çok ilginç buglar kalmış. Öyle ki karşılaştığım bir bugda oyun hata vererek kendini kapattı! Ama bu sinir bozucu kısım sadece oyunun "The Gunpowder Plot" kısmı için geçerli tekrar hatırlatalım.

   Siz yine de o 1 bölümdeki hatalara takılmayın, asıl 4 bölümü hatasız oynayabilirsiniz. Kesinlikle paranızın hakkını veren bir oyun. Oyunu oynamak için tam bir Whovian olmak da gerekli değil. Birkaç bölümünü izlemişseniz ve zaman geçirmek istediğiniz bir oyun arıyorsanız hiç durmadan alabilirsiniz. Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Simulation, Strategy
Reviews:
7 Days to Die is a great game, but any recommendation I could give it is inherently a bit double-edged because I genuinely think it was a better game last year. Just about everything I like about its foundation is still there; it's a survival crafting game that manages to be fully voxel-based and destructible without looking the part, with an emphasis less on exploring randomly generated terrain and more on exploring structures that are randomly placed but hand-made, with each one feeling like a fun mini-dungeon hiding its own little surprises. There's plenty of content, plenty to build, and it lasts a long time before getting old. I spent a long time playing it via gamepass before coming back to put 50 more hours into it with my usual group for 1.0, and we had a good time doing it. But by the end of it, we all had our own complaints as well. The problem with the 1.0 changes aren't that they ruined the game, so much as that they change it ever so slightly into a different type of game than the one we came to it for; it's like right at the end of development someone on the team played an ARPG and had an epiphany. 

Most of the changes feel like they were made for people who have been playing the game for thousands of hours and just want to grind efficiently, rather than new players just wanting to explore and play the game with fresh eyes. A minor example of this is the trader system; in the previous versions, any of the game's different vendors could show up anywhere, and it was possible to get lucky and find towns with two different ones in the area. In 1.0 we eventually moved into a town that had three traders, which was pretty exciting until I realized they were all Trader Hugh (sorry, Hugh) because of them being made biome-specific. You can obviously guess why they did this. For people who already know the game and just want to get going, it takes a lot of the guess work out of finding a trader of a certain type they might need to start optimally instead of having to wander for ages looking for one with a bit of bad luck. But for normal people, those sorts of experiences are practically a cornerstone of the genre; survival crafting games are all about generating funny stories caused by the randomness, and I feel like probably everyone that's ever played one has at least one memory of searching for ages for something and how good it felt when they finally stumbled across it or finding something they didn't even know was in the game after finishing it multiple times. Yeah, it can be frustrating in the moment, but that's why it's called "survival" crafting, not vacation crafting. Get real, man.

The last time I played this game, there was a clothing system that, while not necessarily robust, had a nice amount of variety, as well as minor gameplay elements. You could loot funny hats and put together outfits, customize your character's looks without worrying about stats, and dress for the weather. This has all been replaced with various sets of armor and a promise of re-adding it about a year later. You can still mix and match pieces of armor, and in some ways it can even be preferable with their individual effects, but each set also has a set bonus that encourages you to just wear a full set instead of dressing up the way you want to. Some of the funny items like cigars are still in the game, but only as accessories you equip to your gear with no visual change. And that's adequate -- at least there are still options, and while I wish there were more armor sets they at least look pretty unique -- but it just feels arbitrary, even mechanically. If you went into a snow biome from the start before, your character would end up freezing pretty quickly if you didn't have warm clothes to layer up with, and my first memory of such a thing was spending a night huddled by a campfire in a house surrounded by bears. Which is fun! I love having moments like those in these games. I went there in 1.0 fairly early on expecting to relive the memory, and found that because I had crafted basically any armor set at all I was already above the threshold of the weather doing anything more than a very minor stamina debuff. Why even bother?

But the thing that pisses me off the most is that despite its stat focus, the last time I played the game it did a good job of keeping the progression separate from the gameplay, so that you could comfortably specialize no matter what you chose to do as long as you were killing zombies and generally doing something. There were books you could find that gave unique and fun bonus traits, which are still there, but for the most part you were free to do whatever you wanted without feeling like you were lagging behind anyone you were playing with. In the current build, the entire system has been changed so that nothing really matters except the magazines you've read. Want to make better guns? Read 100 handgun magazines. Want to make better clothes? Without reading 100 issues of Fashion Weekly? C'mon, let's be serious! Nearly every crafting skill in the game now has 100 arbitrary points you have to raise by reading that many magazines (yes, yes, give or take 20 or so if you wear the nerd outfit, sue me geeksquad), and it's as tiring as you'd expect. Unless, of course, you do quests -- which are now basically the only viable way to progress even remotely smoothly, because of how often they reward you with loot boxes full of an assortment of magazines that are usually guided to what you're trying to level. And this, hundreds of words later, is my core problem with the new update. It doesn't matter if you want to loot, if you want to farm, if you just want to kill zombies; if you're not doing quests, you will burn out of the game long before you finish any crafting tree, to the point that it feels actively detrimental to just go out and explore on your own. Even the vendors themselves have been heavily nerfed to the point that most of their inventory is completely arbitrary in favor of the things you can craft at a given time, with their only lingering purpose being selling junk and occasionally buying things you're just too lazy to go find. Which would be fine, if the trader didn't still constantly get hung up on sending you to the same three or four buildings per quest tier or try to send you to Tilted Towers 6,000 meters away if your towns don't generate just right.

I'm sure some poindexter with 10,000 hours in the game is going to come into my comments like "erm, ackshually, the changes added a sense of balance that was greatly desired for the pvp experience", to which I say come at me because I am simply morally superior and way cooler. And despite my complaints, I do still maintain that it is still fun. But the reason behind my great american novel is to give context for the bottom line: is it worth $45? No. I mean, I don't even have to think about it, honestly. When I bought it the game was $25, and I thought that was a fair price then and it's still a fair price now. $45 is frankly a crack pipe price for it in its current state, especially given that it rocketed up that $20 with no meaningful changes from the previous build. But they have a lengthy roadmap listing out things that should have been in anything called "1.0", like bringing back the wardrobe system, adding in bandits, and even story content and new quests, which all sound like excellent ideas. If those end up coming to pass and don't get stripped down after 10 more years of rebalancing then I think the current price tag would be more justified. For now, just wait for a sale and don't be afraid to look into a few mods. | I can't play this game anymore. I got no patiences for this. It seems like the game has gotten worst with every version released in the last 3 years. It seems like the developers look at what players are doing and then deem it exploitative or just don't like it in general and change it. To summarize it, they don't like how the players are playing their game and they want them to play it how they (devs) want them to play it.
We went from alpha 12 creating sand molds for glass jars to now as of b25, no glass jars or containers or anything and want you to die of thirst on day one. We use to build underground and be safe, devs didn't like that and now the zombies dig. We then built air forts or off-ground bases, devs didn't like that and added physics to the blocks and coded zombies to attack the nearest support pillar to force collapse.
You use to build a small structure or clear and rehab a point of interest as a starting base after scouting for ones with forges or being near water. Devs didn't like that and now Poi's are deadly, and sometimes spawn zoms inside after placing your land claim block or bedroll. They marketed the game as a crafting survival game, but now have made it difficult to build and craft and forces you to loot all the time. 
You use to eat once and drink 3-4 times a day, devs didn't like that and now You're constantly starving and thirsty all the time. In alpha 12, you use to read books to unlock crafting or recipes and magazines to increase skills, the devs didn't like that and thought a skill point system would be better. They took the book/mags out in alpha 13-18 then reintroduced it in 19 to co-exist with the skill-point system, but now in b25, you need the books and mags to level up for everything.
You use to heal up and regain stamina after eating or drinking, and now you just a weak ass bitch, since food doesn't recover as much health and water is sparse. They cut down or remove quite bit of assets and gameplay from the game to simplify it and I think that has detracted from the game from it's earlier versions.
Now the fun pimps don't like the stealth mechanic and have null and negate it in the latest version.
That's just a fraction of the evolving changes. The game used to be pretty fun to now being such a total grind and chore, that I can't even stand it for 30 minutes before I quit out. 

I know what you're thinking, I'm complaining about how hardcore and difficult then contradict myself with them simplifying crafting and assets. But if you ever play the earlier versions, it wasn't as much of chore then as more of a realism and understanding basic build process, and it was quite fun. There was more to do. Going "oh I need sand and clay, I need a jar for the mold, I need a forge, some metal or an anvil" and put it all together to get 5 glass jars. Then I need water, pot and campfire. It was all obtainable and you had to manage it and it made it felt like you were trying to survive. 

Now it's like, you have to loot and get lucky, Do about 30 hits on a tree, block or door and now you're thirsty because you've exhausted your stamina repeatedly, so don't run or swing your club and avoid zombies, and hope you find water. It's a walking simulator with a looting mechanic. That's just bad game design. 

The Fun Pimps are not so fun, I think they are pure masochists that enjoy C&B Torture and they are making this game for those that enjoy that type of fetish. | 新版本更新后联机总是出现各种各样的问题。每次和朋友玩都是为了连接服务器花大量时间，往往还没开始正式玩就累了。 | 毎日過ごす中でなんかこうゾンビ倒したいなぁ、拠点作りたいなぁって
そんな気分になる時期があると思うんです
そしたらこのゲームをやれば良いんです
アプデの度にちょっとづつ仕様が変わるのも新鮮味があって好きです | Игра интересная, на часов 100 минимум точно займет вас. Единственное, что разрабы не фиксят моменты с прогрузкой карты, из за этого фпс жестко начинает проседать через несколько отыгранных часов на одной карте.

Game Name: South Park™: The Stick of Truth™
Reviews:
If you're a fan of the show, this game is a must-have.  It perfectly captures the crude humor, outrageous characters, and overall absurdity that makes South Park so iconic.  The writing is sharp, witty, and frequently offensive – in the best possible way.  It's exactly what you'd expect from a South Park game, and it delivers in spades.
 
The gameplay is a surprisingly well-executed RPG.  The combat system is simple but effective, and the turn-based battles are punctuated with hilarious animations and dialogue.  The farting mechanics alone are worth the price of admission.  Seriously, you haven't lived until you've unleashed a devastating fart attack on a group of underpants gnomes.
 
Exploring South Park is a treat in itself.  The game perfectly recreates the town, complete with all its familiar locations and quirky residents.  Running around, interacting with the characters, and completing side quests is a constant source of amusement.  The sheer amount of detail and attention to the source material is impressive.  It's like stepping right into an episode of the show.
 
While the story isn't groundbreaking, it's a fun and engaging adventure that fits perfectly within the established South Park universe.  The characters are all perfectly voiced (with the original voice actors, which is a huge plus), and the plot keeps you entertained from beginning to end.
 
The only minor drawback is that the game can be a little repetitive at times.  The combat system, while fun, can become somewhat predictable after a while.  But honestly, the sheer amount of humor and nostalgia more than makes up for it.
 
Overall, South Park: The Stick of Truth is a fantastic game that any fan of the show should play.  It's hilarious, nostalgic, and surprisingly well-crafted. Highly recommended! | You get to insert yourself into the Southpark world and interact with all the different characters and environments, it's just like playing in an episode.
It's offensive, raunchy, unapologetic and hilarious and i absolutely love it, they don't make games like these anymore.
Clearly made with passion with lots of references, nods and all the different humor and things you'd see in a South Park episode.

Easy recommend if you love South Park. | 这是一款卡通风回合制冒险游戏，通过人类和精灵两大主要阵营围绕着真理之杖（一根平平无奇的木棍）的争夺展开一系列剧情，游戏中存在着大量支线和收集品，无论是不是动画的受众，玩下来也不会觉得枯燥；值得注意的是，游戏没有汉化，部分引导比较糟糕；此外，游戏内充斥着大量的黄段子以及烂俗笑话，画面也相当地低俗血腥，接受不了的朋友慎入。 | Jogo muito bom para quem gosta da série south park. O humor ácido com o RPG de turnos deixa tudo muito bom. E a regra é clara: nunca peide nas bolas de alguém | A día de hoy sigue siendo un juego bastante entretenido, en su tiempo solo faltó una actualización para que este corra en 60 fps y corregir bugs menores.

The gameplay is fire. The concept is fire. Blink, and the world is on fire. | прикольная, но в то же время сложная игра. Постоянно нужно использовать свою мозгу - что, когда, зачем качать, а то людишки как понапридумывают лекарств своих, из-за чего капут будет твоей болезни. А ещё долбаная гренландия не заражается ваще( | This game fills me with deep rage because there will always be a colony of idiots surviving, even if you wipe out every possible continent and city. I found it ridiculous that you have to buy a DLC to play the cure mode, and how a single bacteria can make a fool of you the entire time. 
That said, one of the best games I’ve ever played, I absolutely love it. | 传播疾病的部分在攻略的帮助下迅速上手，但可惜解药那部分属实玩不明白 | its a fun game, but i feel like the ways to lose are a little cheap, like (YOU LOSE! NO HOST LEFT!) or when after the cure is found, people are cured stupidly fast.

I own the board game version of this, and was excited when I found it here on Steam.  Zooloretto offers a fairly quick, semi-strategic game, with cute presentation.  It is perfect for children and those who enjoy a good, casual board game.  

The pros: quick easy games, with no setup; a moderately challenging AI; in-game challenges add to replayability; customized items and characters purchased with earned winnings; great "together" game to play with spouse and/or child.

The cons: AI is respectable, but not too difficult to manipulate; no online multiplayer (though this may not matter for some, like me); the soundtrack can get a little bit old after a while.

For $9.99, this game is a pretty decent deal, and almost anyone who enjoys board games will get their money's worth.  For the $5.99 I got it for on sale, its a steal, and will see far more play than games I've paid substantially more for. | Cons
doesn't support whidescreen 
no online multiplayer 
Pros 
Easy to learn
AI is actually hard to beat
Lots of things to unlock 
You can only unlock things with in game currency, so no micro transactions. 

Overall it's a very nice little board game. 10/10 would buy again. | From what I can tell this is a a very basic port of an iPad version.  For iPad this game might be fine... for PC, no.
Problems:
-No online multiplayer, only local multiplayer, which is NOT made nearly explicit enough in the description.  I bought this assuming it had online multiplayer.
-Terribly limited resolution options.
-No ability to play in windowed mode, only full screen, despite the fact that it won't even take advantage of my monitor's common resolution.
-Some very stupid interface/porting issues.  e.g. When naming your profile you can't even use the keyboard to input, you're forced to click on the onscreen keyboard, like you would on a tablet. | I would love to have a computer version of Zooloretto to play with friends, but this has no multiplayer?  Why on earth would you play a push your luck game against the computer? | As a board game, Zooloretto is great fun.  The same can't be said of this adaptation.  It feels like a cheap mobile port; the controls are clunky., the available resolutions are bad, and the art and music are pretty terrible.  There is also no online multiplayer.  Buy the board game instead.

Game Name: Heroine's Quest: The Herald of Ragnarok
Genres: Adventure, Indie, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews: This game is great. It totally reminds me of the VGA remake of Quest For Glory 1, down to the 3 character classes. Also it's FREE. The voice acting isn't bad at all. If you grew up on Sierra games with your sweet 640KB of RAM courtesy of MS-DOS, you'll be right at home. Luckily, QEMM isn't required. | Nice take on the Quest for Glory series with some extra RPG elements. If you like old Sierra games then I can't recommend this highly enough. | An insanely accurate and fun homage to the age of DOS adventure games. Start with a ton of Quest for Glory, tenderize with a healthy dose of King's Quest, sprinkle a few flakes of rubbing two unlikely items together (in the fashion of Monkey Island) and you end up with a game I would dare to call both neat and also sharp. | An excellent homage to the Quest for Glory games. Good puzzles, interesting characters, and a fun lighthearted take on Norse mythology. Frankly, I want to see more games like this! Gimmee! | +1. Красивый, но слишком сложный квест. Подгорает в основном от необходимости монотонной прокачки навыков в неочевидные моменты игры. Прохождение прилагается, да и игра бесплатная, так что советую.

Однозначно одна из лучших игр золотой эпохи игростроения. Атмосфера и стилистика супер.
Играл еще в 3х дисковую версию. Без гайдов наверно её сложно пройти. Я и с гайдами вроде так и не смог пройти или версия игры с багом была.
Управление в игре только кривоватое и спорное. 

10 шиз из 10 | loved it, great story line and good puzzles. | This game held me on for the entire ride and it’s my first playthrough of it, I am not reliving nostalgia for it. It was very dark, had amazing Sound and Art design, genuinely probably the best for something this early in the genre had ever seen. Pretty much a masterpiece. However, there are a few things that plague it I must mention before I can recommend it

1. Some of the solutions are SUPER OBSURE or Insane during the first actual stage. Now this is not a surprising thing that this genre does, but I must admit the solution for the Bell and the Spring Pig was fucking insane. I sat there for at least a half hour, before getting so mad I looked it up because I had clicked a hair to the right, the spring pig did not work for me until the 2nd time I tried it and THE ITEM WAS SO BLENDED IN I COULD NOT EVEN SEE IT. Sorry it just really upset me, but the rest of the solutions and puzzles were top notch though.

2. There is a repeated glitch I found where if an NPC or yourself is either in the way or not in the exact point that the game wants, the animation and solution will not play. Example: For the Bell solution again, I went to use the item on it, however the NPC with the Lollipop stopped right where I was supposed to go and canceled the animation making me think I was wrong again, since I thought it was weird I tried again, same odd animation. Finally, I realized it was the NPC causing the problem and waited for the little brat to move, thus making the animation work and I could continue.

3. It is totally possible to skip dialog if you do things out of order. I was able to complete an objective at a later level without having to talk to someone about it, either that or I don't even remember which is unlikely cause I literally just finished the game, which leads me to my last thing.

4. Although, without question a masterpiece, the play time and run of the levels is very very short. 9 Hours for me on my first playthrough and sadly only playthrough as I don’t think there will be another because I don’t need the achievements that bad. 

In conclusion, if you like point and click, this game is Fucking awesome! Wear headphones and just imagine what the designers must have had to go through to hit the mark each level as they did, the game is genuinely creepy at times, however, I will admit some of the puzzles were hard and its very short, I would recommend waiting till you can get it on sale like I did, but by god, it makes Wishlist recommendations for sure.

TLDR: Fucking awesome point at click, Very Short, Get it on sale and Fuck Morgan
 | 中文补丁没打成功，好在这部游戏英语难度不高。很庆幸没错过这么好的游戏，尤其是在其十分古早（对于我来说）的情况下。每一章的地图和玩法的不同很有巧思，剧情整体也很好，细节非常多。个人最喜欢的是那种建模的粗糙感，配合精美的场景反而显得很有风格。唯一感觉有点难受的是主角走路太慢了（可以忍受） | Sanitarium is a good old game. I cannot recommend it enough. The story telling is excellent. Sometimes the puzzles needed some help from the internet to figure out, but overall, a great experience that examines a lot about humanity.

🔍 Primeiras Impressões
Se você gosta de mistério, terror psicológico e aquela sensação de desconforto constante, The Last Door é um prato cheio. O jogo aposta num visual pixelado minimalista, mas não se engane: a atmosfera tensa e a narrativa sombria fazem você esquecer os gráficos simples bem rápido.

🎮 Gameplay
É um clássico point-and-click, daqueles que você explora cenários, coleta pistas e resolve enigmas. A jogabilidade é simples, sem pressa ou ação frenética, mas a tensão é real. Você sente que algo terrível pode acontecer a qualquer momento, mesmo quando nada acontece.

🕵️ História e Clima
Inspirado em H.P. Lovecraft, o jogo mergulha em um terror cósmico cheio de segredos obscuros. Você controla Jeremiah Devitt, um homem que recebe uma carta enigmática de um velho amigo e acaba envolvido em eventos macabros. A cada capítulo, mais peças desse quebra-cabeça perturbador vão surgindo, deixando aquela sensação de "quero saber mais, mas também tenho medo de descobrir".

🎨 Visual e Estilo
Os gráficos são ultra pixelados, quase como se fossem de um jogo antigo de 8 bits. Pode parecer um problema, mas na verdade isso aumenta a sensação de mistério. Seu cérebro completa os detalhes que não estão ali, tornando tudo ainda mais sombrio.

🎵 Trilha Sonora
A música e os efeitos sonoros são de arrepiar. Cada nota do piano, cada sussurro no fundo, cada silêncio bem colocado... tudo é usado para deixar você na ponta da cadeira.

🧩 Desafios e Puzzles
Os enigmas são bem bolados, mas às vezes um pouco obscuros. Dá pra travar em algumas partes se você não prestar atenção nos detalhes, mas nada que estrague a experiência.

🏚️ Vale a Pena?
Se você curte terror psicológico, histórias bem escritas e não se importa com gráficos simples, The Last Door é um achado. Ele prova que o medo não vem de sustos baratos, mas sim do que sua mente imagina no escuro.

E aí, já jogou? Se não, tá preparado pra abrir essa última porta? 🚪👁️ | una obra de arte, maravillosa, atmósfera, narrativa, el conjunto y la simetría, la armonía al relatar la historia, la sincronización con la música y la puesta en escena, magnífica. | 무서움.. 너무너무 무서움..
체감상 아웃라스트보다 더 무서운거같음..
큼지막한 도트겜인데도 우째 분위기가 저렇단말임..ㅜㅜ
호달달 떨면서 엔딩봤더염.. |

Game Name: Left in the Dark: No One on Board
Reviews: Lo que pide este juego, es una segunda parte. Muy interesante

Genres: Action, Casual, Indie, Simulation, Strategy, Free To Play
Reviews: Pixel Puzzles UndeadZ es de esos juegos que te enganchan simplemente porque es gratis, colega. Un puzzle con zombis, ¿qué más puedes pedir? Es simple pero entretenido, y como no te cuesta nada, te lo juegas sin remordimientos. Perfecto para matar el rato. | Очень двоякие чувства оставляет очередной проект в серии "Pixel Puzzles". С одной стороны, это разнообразный набор артов по зомби-тематике и две мини-игры (мы добавили вам игру в игру, что бы вы могли играть в игру, пока играете в игру), а с другой стороны ужасные края паззлов, довольно-таки унылый саундтрек и какая-то общая простота. Жаль нет промежуточной рекомендация, а то я выбрал бы её.
Bonjour, petit jeu de puzzle bien sympathique
Puzzle pieces spinning through space. It's an interesting take on jigsaw puzzles that I like.

Game Name: Shadows on the Vatican - Act I: Greed
Reviews:
[h3]Before you buy you need to realize this is NOT completed. Episode 3 is not out, and they have episode 4 planned.[/h3]

This is an episodic game where you have to buy the episodes separately. This came out in 2014, and second episode came out in 2015, it's been over 9 years waiting for Act 3. 

It's not a bad game, but it's a very short game, I know I didn't pay full price and I don't remember when I got the game, it's been sitting in my library for years.
I completed this game in 1 hour and 43 minutes, and the price is 6.99$.
My biggest complaint minus the time it took to beat was the graphics of how James shirt was done

This game and the puzzles are extremely simplistic and it's super easy to get through.
The story is ok, but this is Act 1 so I guess I'm waiting for Act 2 to go on sale because I'm not going to be paying full price if there's a big chance I can finish that in under 2 hours.

According to their website Act 3 is in production as they announced it with a trailer in 2022.

I just can't recommend the game, it might be worth it to play for some, but wait to see if Acts 3 & 4 get released before you pick it up.

Aaaaand that's a wrap! The ending to the great Blackwell games was possibly my favourite of them all in some areas: the character writing was top notch with some of the best stories across the series, and the puzzles were very satisfying, especially as I promised myself not to look up a guide (I caved only once and I feel it was sort of justified). The overarching plot I have more mixed feelings on, with some of it feeling a little rushed, cliched and inconclusive, but as a whole package it sells its emotional moments very well and has secured the Blackwell games series as one of the greats. | During a sale I bought all 5 Blackwell games and played them in order of release. If I remember all 5 cost something like $10, so no big deal. After playing the first, I was pretty sure I wasted $10. But each got incrementally better. Finally, EPIPHANY! A very nice game I can easily recommended. Great plot...but to fully understand parts of it, you have to play the first 4 games, l making them worth the price. Rosa and Joey really grew on me so nice character development. Actually, all the characters in Epiphany grew on me. Having lived a good part on my life in Manhattan, I also appreciated that the development team also knew Manhattan really well. Voice overs are very good and it's pixel art so either love it or leave it. All in all, a big THUMBS UP from me. | An ending that makes sense, yet I could have never predicted. Amazing. I am so proud of the people who worked on this series for the strides they have made over the years. | Loved this game so much. I didn't want the series to end!

The Room is a puzzle game where you solve a series of intricate puzzle boxes to uncover the secret of A.S., the person who called you to solve them.

The gameplay here is pretty simple: you just solve puzzles. Each stage, you're given one puzzle box, and you have to click around to figure out how each part opens or moves. The puzzles weren't very difficult. The only times I got a little bit stuck were because it wasn't clear that something was movable. There were a few puzzle types that were repeated once or twice, but it didn't happen enough to bore me by the end. 

The Room doesn't have a very developed story, but it is very atmospheric. What story you get comes in the form of notes from A.S., which give you some insight into what they were researching. The game has a mysterious vibe to it that gets creepier as you get further into the levels, from the increasing strangeness of the notes, the changing details of the room around you, and the odd noises mixed in with the background music.

This game was originally a mobile game and the movements you have to make were clearly designed with a touch interface in mind. You have to turn keys and cranks and pull up on lids. You also have to move the camera around to see the puzzle boxes from all sides or to line elements up a certain way for some of the puzzles. I played on a computer with a mouse, so some of those movements felt a little awkward. It was also a little annoying to have to adjust the camera so much to see certain things straight on.

Overall, I liked The Room. While the puzzles weren't difficult, I wasn't bored with them, and I enjoyed the creepy atmosphere. Although it was a bit short, I felt like I got a decent value out of the game, and I'm really curious to see what the rest of the series will have to offer. 7/10 | This is one of if not my favourite puzzle game. It's not too long and that is a huge plus. It knows it doesn't need two houndred hours of content to be good and it shows how much dedication they have put in the game with the few hours of pure quality in it | it does indeed contain a room. multiple even. 11/10 surpassed my expectations | Takes a whileeeee to get it done but it is possible! Very fun and challenging at the same time. | Fun game that can be challenging, but still add depth without feeling stymied!

Game Name: Voodoo Whisperer Curse of a Legend
Reviews:
[quote][b]Warning: Broken Game![/b]
This game has design/implementation defects that will render this unplayable for many gamers.  the game doesn't launch properly, it just forces your desktop into a locked 800x600 resolution and hangs, but you can at least alt+tab and kill the game process to recover your desktop.[/quote]

"Voodoo Whisperer Curse of a Legend" is an older game from 2014.  It's a venerable 10 years old at the time of this review.

"Voodoo Whisperer Curse of a Legend" is a Hidden Object puzzle game, the type you normally see on mobile app stores or even as browser apps.  There's literally hundreds of these on Steam, mostly published by Artifex Mundi, many of them free on mobile app stores, but this one will cost you money on Steam.  There's a historial/mystery theme to the game, but this is a just a veneer over a tired and overdone set of hidden object minigames and Adobe Flash tier puzzles, wrapped together with a bunch of static screens that you "move" through by tapping your finger on your iPhone screen.

While these kinds of games are popular amongst casual gamers, it's difficult to argue this is a great value proposition as a PC game, especially considering the price of this compared to the hundreds of free HOGs on the mobile app stores.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The game only displays in 4:3 pillarboxed aspect ratio.  It's possible they developed this using an old CRT they found in a dumpster, or this game has been specifically designed for people gaming on PC's from 1995... either way, this isn't really acceptable in the modern era of PC gaming.

This is a really old game, and if they had made it today, it would be on the mobile app stores, but it predates those.  It's not clear why they didn't try to dump this on the app stores (since it clearly seems to be here as some kind of nostalgia gouge).  Maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes "Voodoo Whisperer Curse of a Legend" might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Unethically, the developers have left this on the Steam store in an unplayable and broken state.  It's the responsibility of the developer to maintain their product, ensure it runs on all modern PCs, or if they determine there's defects and the game doesn't work, they should remove it from sale instead of misleadingly trying to scam gamers into buying knowingly defective products.

This is harmful to Steam and to gamers, not just because it's a direct and intentional attempt to scam people, but because it takes a share of the marketing space and visibility away from other games.  It's polluting Steam and making it harder for gamers to find genuine games and for genuine indie developers who put months or years into making proper games find an audience.

So, should you buy this game?  Is this one of the best of the 100,000+ games on Steam?

The developer is deliberately and unethically trying to scam gamers into paying them the ridiculous price of $4 USD for a game they know is broken.  Don't give it to them.  This is also competing with over 11,000 free games available on Steam, many of them far better than this paid product.
 | [h2] Save New Orleans from A Dark Voodoo Curse [/h2]
Continuing my trend of playing hidden object adventure games, I decided to try this one after an okay experience with [i]The Fog[/i]. This one felt even more fitting for the Spooky Season, which was really lovely.

Set in 19th-century New Orleans, we play as a young girl named Lillian, who is being mentored to use her magical abilities by Marie Laveau, the most powerful voodoo priestess around. However, as we are being taught, an evil and mysterious curse is set upon the entire town, putting each person into a deep sleep-like state and trapping their souls in the spirit world. It’s up to us to save everyone before everything becomes lost in darkness. Throughout our adventure, we will learn spells and create potions that will help with a variety of tasks, from getting objects to returning people’s souls and much more. Can we save our teacher and lift this awful curse for good?

Compared to other HO adventure games, this one felt slightly different, especially in terms of the graphics, but I don’t know if that’s due to the game's age. I really liked how this felt and thought its use of atmosphere was well done. It captured the spooky vibe that I was looking for. In addition to these aspects, I found the story to be intriguing and very engaging, and I wanted to learn more as I went along. However, I will note that the story does feel a little rushed by the end, and the game is definitely a short experience. As a spoiler, [spoiler]it makes sense that it is this way because the game ends with a “To Be Continued…” message, so there was meant to be a sequel.[/spoiler] Sadly, I found out that the team who made this parted ways with Gogii Games right after this came out, so we’ll most likely never see a follow-up. I can’t lie and say that it isn’t disappointing, as the story had so much more potential. If only they had been given more time and funds to complete this.

Other than this, I found the minigames and hidden object scenes to be fun to play. The scenes were a little tricky in terms of finding objects, but the game has a cool feature that allows the cursor to turn into a magnifying glass. That was a neat and handy feature. I also found the potion-making element of this to be cool. All in all, I enjoyed the game despite specific problems, but that isn’t the fault of the developing team. I would still recommend getting this game when it’s on sale as it isn't complete.
[h1] 4 out of 5 ★★★★☆! [/h1]
güzel bir tower defence oyunu 8floor firmasının bilen bilir basit düzeyde ama oynanabilir modda sevdim

平心而论，游戏是个好游戏。无论是由装备决定卡组使得组卡组时要综合考虑不至于每张牌都是烂强卡导致卡组千篇一律，还是多种类型的卡片的组合导致战术的多样化，PVE模式的趣味性和PVP模式的斗智斗勇（特别说一下PVP，这个游戏的PVP是真正的根据每期地图和其他对手决定的，比如对面全法师就能采用三战士六豹打，或者两战一牧，对面带五甲的战士多你的战士就多带破甲和穿甲，总之相对复杂的卡组构建，不断变化的地图和多种多样的战术选择使这个游戏的PVP充满了乐趣），还有趣味联赛中的娱乐性更强的对战，丰富多彩的收集元素，以及良心的日商周商使得不氪金也能轻松成为大佬，种种因素使得这个游戏是不错的游戏，即使没有汉化也不影响它本身的趣味性，看到这里大家就应该明白我对这个游戏的喜爱和推荐了吧。
然而，问题不仅仅这么简单，这么优秀的游戏却有着一群跟我们思维构造不同的GM和MOD，他们在没有事先通知的情况下封了几乎所有参加过PVP的人，而且时间有的多达30天甚至是365天，经常玩这个游戏热爱这个游戏每天游戏时间足够长的所有国人无一幸免，而且申诉机制异常奇怪，真正该封禁的人被解封了，无辜群众反而被关在了里面，据一些因为玩游戏频率不高而侥幸逃过一劫的国人反应，本来偏小众的游戏的在线人数进一步减少，本来一场联赛平时1分钟以内就一定能排到对手现在却排了四五分钟都无法匹配成功，游玩人数大量减少，玩家纷纷弃坑，然而面对这种结果，GM和MOD却仍然表示满意，绝对自己做得很是正确。另外，由于这个游戏是人治，所以管理上有明显的偏袒，和mod关系好的人不会被封禁然而其余人很容易被封禁，据少数国人反应，游戏内可能有一定反华倾向，在世界打字中文会收获到举报，总之你一定要做好随时被封禁的心理准备即使你只是正常的老老实实的玩游戏。一次封禁很有可能直接抹消掉你之前的时间和金钱投入，所以，即使这个游戏很有趣，但大家入坑前还是要慎重，即使决定了入坑，购买付费内容的时候还是要慎重，毕竟，他们封禁你的时候不会在乎你花了几百几千人民币的。 | Pros:  I was transported back in time 30 years, the flavor and feel of PnP RPG gaming is perfect.  The metagame story is fun and interesting.  Felt like the 1980s...

Cons:  The micropayment cash grab is gross.  You can play free for @30hrs, then you need to start buying access.
Also: this game is a _very cheap_ strat game, with minimalist card building elements.

If you want to feel the nostalgia - play for free.  Any other reason should be a pass.

I give it a thumbs up BARELY and only for the story and feels.  The game is a grind - barely entertaining. | 平时网好的时候用网页版，方便。只有网不好才用客户端，所以看起来游戏时间很少。
算上网页版至少700hrs+
好玩，时间证明一切。

This game is an improved version of the original flash games, with a unique, old flash-game style I really adore honestly. 
The gameplay is often micromanagement, but I find it fun. This game was a worthwhile investment. | if you played previous 2 rebuild games this game is for you system requirements not so steep and i already finished the 1st city on story mode and 1 city in quick play on normal | I remember playing the two original rebuilds on a browser using flash when i was a child, and was very excited to finally play the final one on steam. It's rather enjoyable and I Definitely got my moneys worth, although there are a few things that make me not want to play it again.

The fact it isn't turn based makes it a bit more tedious than the two original ones as you must constantly pause in order to give them new missions, along with how you must position your defenders instead of them all counting towards a defence total. Also, the requirement to ally or eliminate all other factions to win a map makes it so that you need to tediously spam donations a few dozen times before you can move on to the next. Otherwise, it's still rather fun, and a nice finale to the series. | Best game ever made. This game is so awesome ><. So simple but so awesome. She made it so you can make mods for it. I'm going to have to start playing with that. There is even a workshop tab in steam with some mods. | Kesinlikle eğlenceli. Öncesinde 2. oyunu oynayarak temel sürece hakim olmanızı öneririm.

[h1] [Dracula: The Resurrection]: «Кол В Классику?» [/h1]

Сразу скажу, что с оригиналом 2000 года я не знаком…

Моё погружение в тёмные уголки мрачной Трансильвании начались именно с её переделки под Android 2014 года. 

К добру ли это или к худу? Кто знает... Но честно говоря, это не столь важно, так как приключение мне всё равно понравилось, даже и без манящей глубины оригинала!

Запуская игру, я не знал, чего именно стоит ждать, поэтому первые полчаса пребывал в лёгком раздражённом недоумении…

Что это за фигня? Статичные картинки? В 2000-м году то, серьёзно? Значит, перемещаемся мы только между заранее заготовленными сценами? Но ведь даже в далёкой «Eye of the Beholder» 1991 года мы могли бодренько скакать себе по квадратом, используя привычное всем управление! А тут, стало быть, это не вариант? Тыкай мышкой по указанному направлению и взлетай? Мдаааа... И правда тёмные силы не на шутку разбушевались… 

Сюжет, надо полагать, отталкивается больше от фильма Копполы нежели от книги Стокера? Нуууу…ладно, пускай. Хотя стоящая ли это идея, тоже не очень понятно…

Более того, игра не особенно то стремилась мне хоть что=либо объяснить! Греби как говорится. Вперёд! Вот те мышка, вот те крест! х)))

Короче, собирался я уже вырубить игру и махнуть на всю франшизу ногой как вдруг умудрился найти какого-то ушлого бандита и…грохнуть его?! Серьёзно?! Вот это было неожиданно, честное Бельмонтское! Отлично! А то это уже начинало напоминать какой-то детский утренник, где-нибудь за полярным кругом, где ночь по 30 дней длится, а тут такая радость! Воооот… Это разговор… Погодите-погодите ка, дайте ещё полчасика поиграю в это наследие нулевых… =))) 

Так дело у меня и пошло! 😉

Оказалось, игра то просто отличная. Нужно было только пообвыкнуться с её непривычной дубовостью и всё! Скажу даже больше, ко второй части мне эта её неповоротливость настолько понравилась, что я не хотел даже, чтобы этот стиль менялся. Нет, это отличный медитативный поход против зла, с кучей замысловатой машинерии, так горячо любимой ребятами из Microids! (привет, Syberia и Amerzone ^-^)

Дракула тут тоже самобытный вышел и с характером. А ещё у него тут хейтеры завелись! Красота то какая! Кол в графа хочу вбить не я один? Интригующе =))) 

В общем с удовольствием я прошёл путём Носферату и стырил всё стыренное им обратно! (кто прошёл игру – знают о чём я говорю) 😉

Если есть желание душевно отдохнуть в атмосфере олдскульой мистики и вампирщины – Вы пришли по адресу! 

Игра прямо-таки создана, чтобы выдернуть Вас из бешеного ритма современной жизни и гейминга, и втянуть в свой неторопливый уютный поток тёмного повествования, увлекая на пару тройку часов. Как раз то что порой нужно! 

Когда запускал вторую часть уже ждал этого медленного slow-life геймплэя и не обманулся в своих ожиданиях!

[i] Игра расцветает на контрасте с бешеным экшеном современного игростроя…и, чем Влад не шутит, самой Жизни… =))) [/i]

Leider nicht zu empfehlen, das originale Spiel ist viel besser. Die ganze Atmosphäre stimmt nicht mehr, Geräusche wurden vereinfacht, Rätsel einfach weggelassen, Effekte, die das Spiel ausmachten, entfernt. | Super bad port it barely contains the original game. Don't buy it. | Ich habe es Damals auf PS1 gespielt.  ist nach wie vor ein tolles spiel

Game Name: Rhiannon: Curse of the Four Branches
Reviews: het is een goed spel

[h1] Очередная жадность очередного издателя [/h1]
Некрономикон - золотая классика квестовых игр начала нулевых, с возможностью исследовать мир в полной изометрии на 360 градусов (до разработок виара было еще 20 лет). Новых игроков в это играть вряд-ли заставишь, а вот старичкам будет интересно поностальгировать. Но есть несколько нюансов:
1)Оптимизации никакой нет. Вот вообще. На большом мониторе глазки будут плакать крокодильими слезами - разрешение 640х480, яркость и контрастность просто никакие,локализацию качаем отдельно, по весу игры
2)баги. Они немногочисленны, но коварны настолько, что могут заруинить прохождение (как и в моем случае, допроходить пришлось на ютубе). Внимательно изучите руководство в стиме, где игру нужно обновить, и будьте внимательны на середине [spoiler] если после лаборатории не прогрузилось видео, значит игра сломалась, и дальше ее проходить не нужно [/spoiler]

Сама игра хороша, но лягушатники отличаются невероятным по человеческим меркам раздолбайством, и починкой своих игр не занимаются из принципа. Поэтому при покупке игры имейте это в виду | Вернулся спустя много лет, чтобы завершить начатое - выполнено! Пройдено и забыто...

Muy divertido, me recuerda mucho a "Ben there, Dan that".
Los gráficos son muy cutres, y algunos puzzles tienen una lógica un poco extraña (defecto común en las aventuras gráficas). El gameplay es lento, y los controles se podían haber integrado mejor. 
Pero tiene mucho sentido del humor, y el protagonista hace comentarios graciosos de casi cualquier cosa que se te ocurra. Además, al ser corto, los defectos del juego se ven reducido mucho.
Muy recomendable.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
Reviews:
Giriş:
Unturned, Nelson Sexton tarafından geliştirilen ve 2014 yılında erken erişime açılan ücretsiz bir hayatta kalma oyunudur. Oyun, blok tarzı grafiklerle sunulan bir dünyada geçer ve oyuncuların hayatta kalmak için kaynak toplaması, barınak inşa etmesi ve zombilerle savaşması gerekmektedir.

Oynanış:
Unturned, oyunculara geniş bir dünya sunar. Kaynak toplama, yiyecek bulma ve silah yapma gibi temel hayatta kalma unsurlarıyla doludur. Zombilerle dolu bu dünyada, hayatta kalmak için stratejik düşünmek önemlidir. Ayrıca, oyuncular arasında işbirliği yapma veya rekabet etme seçeneği de vardır.

Kendi Yorumum:
Oynanış dinamikleri oldukça eğlenceli ve bağımlılık yapıcı. Özellikle arkadaşlarla birlikte oynandığında, keşif ve hayatta kalma unsurları çok daha keyifli hale geliyor. Ancak, bazen oyunun basit grafikleri ve mekanikleri bazı oyuncular için çekiciliğini azaltabilir.

Grafikler ve Ses:
Unturned, blok tarzı grafiklerle sunulmasına rağmen, bu tasarımın kendine özgü bir cazibesi var. Ses efektleri, oyunun atmosferini destekliyor, ancak bazen daha fazla çeşitlilik bekleyebilirsiniz.

Kendi Yorumum:
Grafikler basit olsa da, bu durum oyunun eğlencesini etkilemiyor. Hatta bazı oyuncular bu tarzı sevebilir. Ancak, daha gerçekçi bir deneyim arayanlar için hayal kırıklığı yaratabilir.

Topluluk ve Mod Desteği:
Unturned, aktif bir topluluğa ve geniş bir mod desteğine sahiptir. Oyuncular, çeşitli modlar ve sunucular aracılığıyla oyunu özelleştirebilir. Bu, oyunun ömrünü uzatır ve farklı deneyimler sunar.

Kendi Yorumum:
Topluluk, oldukça destekleyici ve yenilikçi. Modlar, oyunun eğlencesini artırıyor ve sürekli yeni içerikler sunuyor. Ancak, bazı sunuculardaki toksik davranışlar can sıkıcı olabilir.

Sonuç:
Unturned, hayatta kalma oyunları arasında kendine özgü bir yer edinmiştir. Basit ama eğlenceli yapısıyla, oyunculara hem zorlu hem de keyifli bir deneyim sunar. Eğer arkadaşlarınızla birlikte eğlenceli bir hayatta kalma oyunu arıyorsanız, Unturned kesinlikle denemeye değer. Kişisel olarak, bu oyunun sunduğu eğlence ve topluluk etkileşimleri, onu benim favori oyunlarımdan biri haline getiriyor. | ein bester server und spilt es holt euch das gold dlc | KA*AR ERAYIN BİLGİSAYARININ KALDIRDIĞI TEK OYUN | yes, and yes | 不好玩

It's simple, violent, and full of zombies. What's not to like?

Actually, it's a little more than that. Especially the way that you can use different bit of equipment to make weapons, and different parts of the environment. No special "weapons with buffs", it's like - here's an example: you get basic arrows. If you use them to shoot down some birds, you can then use the feathers to make better arrows. Similarly, you can make better classes of axes as you go, make health kits, etc.

And Kovac's rules. In its very "off" sort of way, it's pretty funny. | Не хватает словарного запаса и фантазии описать насколько нравится и затягивает геймплей.



"... Очередным, мирным и ничем не примечательным вечером, преисполнившись после тяжёлого дня на работе, он удобно расположился в уютном кресле, да перед потрескивающим камином, да ещё и под теплым пледом, потягивал горячий глинтвейн и слушал тихий эмбиент лопающихся пузырьков упаковочной плёнки и считал мгновения до того момента..."
Игра на стим деке увеличивает это удовольствие в n раз. | игра супер, а продолжение еще лучше, все в меру, для новичков будит немного сложновато по началу, но поиграв и поняв что и как, будит все хорошо)) | Das Spiel ist/war gut. Hat Spaß gemacht zu spielen. War das erste Spiel dieser Art für mich. Werde es auch irgendwann nochmal spielen, jedoch mit einem anderen Charakter. Top und auf jeden Fall zu empfehlen...! | «How to Survive» — это как симулятор выживания для тех, кто считает, что «тетрис» слишком сложен.
Тут вас бросят на остров с зомби, криво нарисованным героем и крафтингом, который напоминает попытку собрать атомную бомбу из палок и гoвна.
Да, ваша задача — не сдохнуть от голода, жажды или тупых мобов, которые бегут на вас, будто вы последняя бутылка водки в апокалипсисе.
Графика тут на уровне офисного Paint, зато даже ваш пентиум 1999 года не взорвется — идеально для перекуров между отчётами. 

Сюжет? А х*й его знает, там какой-то мужик в радио учит вас не жрать гнилое мясо (но спойлер: вы всё равно его сожрёте). 
Плюсы: можно потроллить друга в коопе, пока вы оба тупо бегаете за кокосами. 
Минусы: через час игры хочется выжить уже от самой игры, но этот факт не помешал мне провести там 50+ часов. 

Итог: 7 зомбаков из 10.

A simple but fun zombie action/puzzle game. | Геймплей оказался простым, но затягивающим. Постепенно уровни становятся сложнее, и приходится продумывать каждый шаг, чтобы обойти вооружённых врагов и собрать свою зомби-команду. Визуальная часть минималистична, но приятна, а анимации выглядят плавно и органично. Однако спустя некоторое время игровой процесс начинает повторяться, и новые уровни уже не приносят такого удовольствия.

Плюсы
✅ Интересная концепция: Играть за зомби — это свежий и необычный взгляд на жанр.
✅ Стратегический геймплей: Требуется планировать действия и искать пути обхода врагов.
✅ Приятная визуальная стилистика: Простая, но симпатичная графика.
✅ Плавные анимации: Движения персонажей смотрятся аккуратно и естественно.

Минусы
❌ Однообразие: Уровни и задачи начинают повторяться довольно быстро.
❌ Короткая продолжительность: Игра проходится за пару часов.
❌ Ограниченный контент: Хотелось бы больше разнообразия в уровнях и механиках.
❌ Низкая реиграбельность: После одного прохождения возвращаться к игре нет особого смысла.

Итоговая оценка: ⭐ 5 из 10
I, Zombie — это неплохая стратегическая головоломка с интересной концепцией и простым, но приятным геймплеем. | iyi hoş oyun elbette ama belli bir zamandan sonra tıkanıyonuz  ama valla aşırı iyi oyun 2d ve keyif veriyo sarıyo çok zor birşeyi başarıyor yazdığımdaki fiyatına yetmez ama benim zamanında aldığım paraya değerdi fiyatı 1 dolar falan olsa 10/10 | Geralmente jogos assim são muito subestimados, MAS O QUANTO DE RAIVA VOCÊ VAI PASSAR. This game was my introduction to Jane Jensen's work.
I haven't played the original GK (1993) but I did watch a playthrough.

This game is great, and I had a fun time being sucked into the world of Jane's creations yet again.

I did have a hard time originally getting into the game because of Gabriel and how he is, but honestly glad I pushed through it because he's really not all that bad. He shows a lot of growth by the end of the game, you watch him grow and change and it's great. Same with her other games including Gray Matter and Moebius, Jane's great at showing change and characters growth.

I really liked this game and it was a fun and wild ride. The writing is intriguing and beautifully done, the characters are all done very well, and I really like the music. Some of the music from this game is still on my favorite play lists.

I did notice from the OG to this version they did make a few changes, anywhere from adding or removing puzzles/changing the way some puzzles were done. 
Obviously the VA's changed too. Which isn't a bad thing, but I can understand the gripe with Gabriel's new voice, not gonna lie I did have a hard time because the way the southern voice was done didn't fit him.

My biggest issue is still the mime puzzle, I remember having a hard time with it the first time and I hated that puzzle the most. When I went to go replay I was dreading dealing with that puzzle again. The second time the mime warped across the screen and the puzzle broke so I had to restart the game, but I got it on the second try.
So that puzzle still seems to be bugged.


I doubt things will change now that Microsoft has  GK but here's to hoping Jane came make GK4.
I genuinely liked the game, and I think it's worth playing.
