10 ghosts, 8 friends, 1 disgruntled girl friend who plays at being a witch, and a Jumanji-like game board all on Halloween night, as if this would not cause enough trouble even in real life, let alone on an acclaimed haunted farm.  

Story: Dylan is invited to a Halloween party of friends by her girlfriend Samantha (with special interest falling on Parker, the unrequited love).  While Dylan is taking a phone call from her concerned mother all her friends are sucked in the Jumanji-like game board.  (I personally do not think Miss Disgruntled (Dylan's girlfriend, Samantha) actually realized the game board was haunted by the ghosts of a previous tragedy.  The "haunted" game board simply recognized similar natures, and history repeats.)  Simple enough story line.
NOTE:  I really like the opening where the car headlights light up the pumpkin from behind before the car is seen and drives past.
NOTE 2: Safety announcement: Please do not talk on your cell phone while driving even if it is your mom calling.

Of all the reviews I read, good and bad, after I played the game I only have this to say: This is an old school Hidden Object game.  This is how they all used to be when actual story lines were first being introduced and being refined.  The games centered on the Hidden Object scenes, with the occasional pick up of inventory items to be used later or to solve some puzzle.  The games were not as strictly linear as they are now, but had a more "open world" feel with "bottle necks".  The games were also not nearly as "hand-holding" as they are now.  The gamer had to think and OMG guess about what had to be done, plus click everywhere.  Yes it was and is annoying and frustrating but that is partly what made the game challenging, out thinking the game/developers.    

Being a fool for old school this was a really refreshing game for me to play.  Very different puzzles and needing a completely different mind set compared to more recent and HD graphic "hand-holding" games of today.  One of the complaints centered on the half-completed objects in the hidden object scenes.  Well all I can say to that is you got what you clicked (Do remember this game was made before 3D was standard, so the objects were drawn in, not overlayed.)  

The actual puzzles of this game include suduko, logic, slide, matching, "minesweeper" among many other types.  This game includes a vast and usually unseen variety of puzzles compared to the color, sound, and match fare of today.  So no crying about how hard the puzzles are, expand your repertoire.   

If you want a challenging game and are bored with the standard fare of today, try yesteryear (in game time 2 years is like 2 centuries).  This game overall is quite challenging.  No penalties for hints which I had almost forgotten about being so used to today's games where there are penalties for hints, map use, and misclicks.  Hints were standard fare in old school and the gamer was expected to use the hint button... a lot, as well as be click "happy".  Guides and YouTube did not exist then like they do now.  

Old school games did not have (or require) achievements, in-game or later the all important steam achievements.  They especially did not require trading cards to even be considered playable.  So if as a gamer one is looking for those things, this game has none of that.  So welcome to the adult version of "Highlights" and enjoy what made the games of today what they are today. | Я потратил 5 часов жизни на прохождение этой *игры*, но так и не смог пройти ее до финала. На 6том часу у меня слетели сохранения и это событие погубило мои нервные клетки. По ходу игры было множество багов, вылетов, ошибок и т.д. Я очень не советую вам покупать эту игру! Редко пишу подобные обзоры, но это плохая игра, это ужасная и глючная игра! | Tout part sur le principe d’un bon gros teen movie et j’avoue que j’ai pris peur au départ… :

La protagoniste, qui va retrouver son meilleur ami pour lequel elle a un penchant, à une soirée, se fait accueillir par une gothique jalouse au sourire cruel. Soirée d’halloween autour d’un jeu type widja. Je vous laisse deviner ? Donc, notre protagoniste s’en tire bien (on peut remercier maman pour son coup de fil) Pour sauver sa bande elle va devoir percer le mystère qui englobe la maison hantée en délivrant les fantômes du passé de leurs péchés.  

Les cinématiques sont jolies, crayonnées en noir et blanc : beaucoup de caractère. Les personnages sont intéressants et l’intrigue plaisante à suivre. On parle quand même d’amour secret, de mariage raté, de suicide et de vaudou. Rien que ça !

-Bon…je déplore quand même l’introduction et la conclusion qui se sont résumées à un black screen me concernant…d’autres se plaindront de l’absence de sous-titres pour les cinématiques mais bon, dans l’ensemble, je pardonne.

Les décors, l’ambiance prennent bien tout en respectant la thématique fantomatique et halloweenesque et les SOC Scènes d’Objets Cachés sont assez complexes pour les rendre intéressant.

 | A spooktacular game of mystery and evil perfect for halloween.  Those new to mystery games will find themselves hitting the hint button alot, though the game is friendly to new players since any puzzle can be skipped or the hint button can be hit if stuck.  Cant get lost because there is a map highlighting where an object of importance is to continue the story.  

The Hidden Object Puzzles can be very difficult, there are things that can be moved on screen in the puzzles, meaning you just need to click everything to see what moves if there is an item behind it since there is no cursor change.  Due to the games age many objects are difficult to spot due to them being very small or the detail is so low they cant be clearly seen.  During puzzles it may ask to find a heart, or a knife, but there will be tons of hearts or knives meaning finding some arbitrary one.  Other times objects are just named wrong such as saying "darts" but there are none instead there is a dartboard you click instead.  

There are not many full on Halloween games on steam so this is worth trick or treating it up.
Rating:  7/10  Value:  $2.99 | [h1]Short version: 53%[/h1]
If you like ghost stories, then this mediocre game should worth a few bucks for you, especially if it is on sale. It’s far from being the worst hidden object title on Steam, but even further of being the best.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Shadows: Price of Our Sins had a really sound idea behind it: a hidden object puzzle game featuring a ghost story about witchcraft, love, betrayal and tragedy. It’s the execution that suffers.

The game has no voiceover after the intro, so everything is told in large– and frankly, very boring– text dumps. Also, the main plot seen at the beginning pretty much disappears, and never gets a proper resolution: after solving the final puzzle, it just… stops.
The puzzles range from bad to above average. They are also repetitive, with an uncomforting emphasis on colour puzzles. Despite this it is recommended to play it on an easier difficulty, since they follow little logic: key items just turn up abruptly in the most unexpected places.
The graphic style fits well to the atmosphere, but it is also quite dated, which really shows in the meticulous pixel hunting of the hidden object scenes.

Alex Hunter é um detective particular chamado para solucionar o caso de Emily Patterson. Ela quer encontrar seu pai que está desaparecido há semanas, um famoso cientista que “convenientemente” sumiu. Sem dar muitas pistas de seu paradeiro, Alex Hunter recebe a chave da casa de Isaac Patterson para investigar. Além de ter que trabalhar com a polícia local mesmo sabendo que não gostam da ideia do detetive particular solucionar o caso antes, ele percebe que as coisas que decorrem são muito estranhas...

On this good game has all. | Alex Hunter, kütüphanemde yer alan sayısız oyundan bir tanesiydi. Ona öncelik vermemdeki asıl sebep yıllar evvelinden benim de çeviri grubunda yer aldığım oyunçeviri gibi güzide bir çeviri sitesinin bu oyunu çevirmesi oldu. Ben de türün müdavimlerinden biri olarak neden olmasın dedim ve başladım oynamaya. Bu yüzden öncelikle oyunçeviri ailesine teşekkürü bir borç bildiğimi ifade etmem gerek. Bunu da ifade ettikten sonra elimizden geldiğince bir şeyler karalayarak, yardımcı olmaya çalışalım.

Şu ana kadar pek çok dosyayı içinde bulunduğu karanlıktan gün yüzüne çıkaran ve olayları aydınlatan Alex Hunter adındaki özel bir dedektifi oynatıyoruz. Günün birinde ünlü bir bilim adamı olan Isaac Patterson ardında hiçbir iz bırakmadan ortalıklardan kaybolur ve polis işi çözmek için devreye girer. Polis her klişe senaryoda olduğu gibi bu işi de eline yüzüne bulaştırır ve işin içinden çıkamaz. Bu salatalıklardan bi' cacık olmayacağını anlayan Patterson'un kızı olayı bizim gibi ünlü ve özel bir dedektife bırakmaya karar verir. Karakterimiz, bunun kendisi için çantada keklik bir vaka olduğunu ve işi aldığını ifade eder. Babanı bulduktan sonra seni istemeye de gelirim artık kız diye kaş göz işareti yapmayı da ihmal etmez. Şaka bir yana olaya el atan Alex, ipucu yakaladıkça bu vakanın umduğundan farklı olduğunu ve hayat memat meselesi olduğunun farkına varır. Sıradan bir vaka bir anda bütün dünyayı ilgilendiren bir mesele haline gelir. Spoiler olmasın diye söylemiyorum, amacımız bu meseleyi tümüyle ortadan kaldırmaktır.  

Alex Hunter Lord of the Mind, saklı nesneleri bolca bulmamız gereken ve bulmacalarla dolu tıkla ve ilerle şeklinde gelişme kaydettiğimiz bir macera oyunu. Bana olay örgüsünü tahtaya yansıtması olsun, sağlam düşünülmüş bulmacaları olsun ne yalan söyleyeyim bir Sherlock Holmes havası hissettirdi. Arada sırada bu bulmacalar beni çıldırtmadı değil ama yine de çözmek için uğraştığım her bir dakikasına değdi diyebilirim. Neyse lafı fazla uzatmayalım da oyunun gülü ve dikeni diyebileceğimiz noktalarına değinelim. 

[u]Artıları[/u]
+Bulmacalar sağlam düşünülerek oluşturulmuş.
+Görseller göze hitap ediyor, çizimler oldukça başarılı.
+Olayların birbiri ile bağlı olup olmadığını gösteren bir olay örgüsü mevcut ve bu bir tahtanın üzerine işlenmiş. Bir noktadan bir noktaya gidebilmek için hızlı seyahat özelliğini kullanabiliyoruz.
+Tatmin edici bir oyun süresine sahip olması
+Müzikleri sıkmıyor aksine insan ruhunda dinlendirici etkisi yaratıyor.
+Günlüklerde sadece karakterimizin yaptığı yorumlar değil, bulduğumuz ipuçlarının orjinal hallerinin de bir köşede yer alması

[u]Eksileri[/u]
-Bu tür oyunlar için en önemli unsur senaryolardır. Klişe bir senaryoya sahip olması büyük bir eksiklik olarak karşımıza çıkıyor.
-Resmi Türkçe dil desteğine sahip olmaması (Bu benim için çok önemli o yüzden bir kez daha Oyunçeviri ailesine buradan teşekkürler)
-Ekstra bölümün olması oyun için bir artı olabilirdi ancak sırf oyunu uzatmak için yapılmış olması ve gereksiz yere uzatılması benim için koca bir eksiden öteye gidemiyor.

Sonuç itibariyle artısı ve eksileriyle Alex Hunter Lord of the Mind evet belki çok iyi bir oyun olmayabilir ama yine de uygun bir indirimde bir şans vermek yerinde bir karar olacaktır diye düşünüyorum. Hem vurdulu kırdılı oyunlardan arada sırada uzaklaşmakta fayda vardır diyorum ve herkese iyi oyunlar diliyorum. [6/10]




 | Unfortunately, I'm not recommending "Alex Hunter - Lord of the Mind Platinum Edition."  The game's got acceptable graphics for what it is.  But, it has enough gameplay issues that I just can't recommend it.  To wit:

- This is supposedly a Hidden Object Game (HOG).   In a HOG, the non-HOG puzzles should be perception-based with some mild logic puzzles of putting together the pieces you have.  There are certainly HOGs in this game.  But, in general, the non-HOG puzzles are mostly what appear to be heavy logic puzzles.  In reality, they're really just brute force puzzles.  With a logic puzzle, you examine the situation, figure out the rules, and determine that the answer is X.  In these brute force puzzles, you can't do that.  The best you can do is look at the situation, figure out the rules, and optimize your moves to try to minimize the combinations you have to try before stumbling upon the answer that works.  Very frustrating in a HOG-type game.

- The game will randomly re-activate HOGs you've already done, but give you no game-based reason to go back to that area and see that a HOG has re-activated.  The only way you figure it out is when you're stuck and either look at the map to see an old area now has something for you to do there, or wander back through all the accessible areas to see.

- The story is even more filled with holes than the story in other HOGs.

Yes.  I got about 8 hours of play out of the game.  But, the game is just not good enough to recommend.  I suppose if you can find it for a couple of dollars or in a heavily discounted bundle, you could try it.  Just be aware of the situation. | Play as Alex Hunter, private investigator, hired by Miss Patterson to find her missing scientist father.  Fortunately this game has nothing to do with the 'Maltese Falcon' or 'The Shadow' beyond that "noire" flare.  Takes place in the late 1800's, I estimate, from the crazy inventions and steam powered "science" which inspires today's steam punk.  (I really love the elevator.) Action/adventure/mystery all rolled into one.  Damsel in distress, rescue her father, stop the crazy "mad" scientist and save the world, what more could one ask for?   

Well executed linear storyline with just a place or two that feels "padded".  Mostly point and click, but enough hidden object scenes to still be an actual hidden object game.  Puzzles of various types and not all of them in the neat little game puzzle boxes.  Some of the more puzzling aspects of this game is simply trying to figure out how to do something, or just where an item is.  I must point out that I really liked the fact that if the player thinks they need a screwdriver, they really do need a screwdriver and not a coin or bobby pin or some other obsure, does not quite make sense item to solve something.  It simply becomes a matter of where is the screwdriver.  As far as actual designated puzzles I only remember one as being a down right frustration.  Since there is no penalty for skipping a single puzzle, I skipped after about 10 minutes of game time.  After I skipped I remembered there was a walkthrough and I could have looked up the solution. C'est la vive.

I hope this becomes a series because I really like the character Alex Hunter.  He reminds me of Humphrey Bogart for some reason, that cynical, rather jaded overlook on life probably, or could just be the voice acting in the introduction.  Regardless I really would like to go through those previous cases involving fraud, theft, bribery, and murder.  Sounds like a good adventure to me.

This game has those hidden/ghost/shape shifting objects so do not miss them, since the previous chapters lock so there is no going back.  There is a bonus chapter after finishing the main storyline, in game achievements, and accesible extras (wallpapers, production sketches).  Steam also has achievements and trading cards.  

All in all an excellent game, and I personally like the pregame music.

This is an extremely well done game. I played it a couple times before ever getting Steam and then, once I became a Steam addict, I bought this game for the cards. And played it again. And now I'm playing it for the fourth time. Yes, it's really that good. If you're a hidden object fan, you should definitely check this out. | Whats behind 1000 doors?  Good voiceacting with lots of spooky stories because you play the super spook detective Kate Reed!  The hidden object puzzles are real creative, instead of looking like a flea market threw up they fit the scenery for item hunting.  There is a hint button, and the puzzles arent too difficult, but you cant stuck because if a person wants to just throw their life away they can hit the "skip" button bringing shame and dishonor upon their family.    A helpful map indicates areas of interest because with 1000's of doors a map is kinda critical.  ooOOoooo the artwork is so nice in this game, everything looks so spooky and the objects in the Hidden Object Games are very crisp and clear so people shouldnt struggle to much.  This game plays like a book, its a very exciting page turner, where instead of just one story there are several stories to free the ghosts trapped here on earth.  The house can travel through space and time, so who knows where you might end up!  

There is a bonus game after the main game that lets you solve some additional mysteries.  More than just a mere room its a whole series of events, puzzles, and more hidden object games so this game is a good value at the price.

(A concept art gallery would have been nice because the art is very good, seeing how it came to life would be nice.)
Rating:  10/10  Value:  $9.99 | 系列解密作的开端

在主线中很多没有用到的场景谜题将在该模式下被解开
 | 喜欢冒险解密的推荐！
一次酣畅淋漓的游戏体验，从开头动画就可以感觉其精细，不管是找物还是小游戏解谜都难度适中，虽然有个简单的令我印象深刻的小游戏，但因为之前的找物环节配合的好反而让人觉得的谜题节奏把握的很好。
仔细想想剧情也并不新颖……但是这是通关后说的话，游戏体验是悬念吊得好，演出气氛到位，中途一次也没有出戏，并且真的有一幕受到了惊吓
虽说画风略阴郁，但里面的猫猫狗狗和姑娘都挺美的
在Sinister Stories Bundle打折时入手，感觉挺值

缺点是没有汉化，并且没有地图传送并需一个个场景转换 | Ich stieß durch Zufall auf dieses Wimmelbildabenteuer, als ich die Halloween-Angebote durchstöberte und war sehr positiv überrascht von dem Spielerlebnis. 
Da ich von der Geschichte nicht allzuviel spoilern möchte, sag ich nur so viel: Man lernt die verschiedensten Geister mit ihren Geschichten kennen und hilft ihnen ihren Frieden zu finden. 

In der Hauptstory begegnen einem viele detailreiche Wimmelbilder, eine Vielzahl an leichten und schwierigeren Rätseln, sowie interessante geschichtliche Hintergründe. Falls man Hilfe benötigen sollte, erhält man diese durch einen Leitfaden. Beendet man das Hauptspiel, schaltet man automatisch ein Bonuskapitel frei, welches einen weiteren Auftrag bereithält.
  
Die graphische Darstellung, die schöne, atmosphärische Musik und die Geschichte waren stimmig. Für zwischendurch kann ich dieses Spiel also nur weiterempfehlen.

Conclusion first,I like it!This game is perfect!
CV,character model,gameplay,more little games,more thinking,rather than continuously looking for hidden objects,COMPLETELY beat Artifex Mundi.
There's no Chinese language,dishonest label,text is easy to understand though.
Very traditional old-fashion story,going to somewhere mysterious,finding the missing dad,reminds me of Johnson's movie"The Mysterious Island".Old,but still interesting.
Spoiler:[spoiler]No one dies in the game,[/spoiler]very old-fashion,emm,acceptable,I guess mom was “killed” by the evil magic
PS:
Strange,the girl,I mean "I",saw an elf in my old house,didn't panic at all.I mean,wow,she was so calm. | Un'avventura punta e clicca con pregi e difetti. Il punto di forza è senza dubbio la varietà dei puzzle, mai ripetitivi: ogni sfida è unica e stimolante. Un tocco di classe sono i criceti nascosti, la cui storia si sblocca progressivamente catturando questi piccoli personaggi, aggiungendo un piacevole incentivo all’esplorazione.

Il tallone d'Achille è il gameplay frammentato: troppo andirivieni tra ambienti per completare un singolo puzzle. La continua necessità di spostarsi, prendere oggetti, tornare indietro, craftare componenti e poi riposizionarli diventa presto faticosa e spezza il ritmo dell’avventura.

Nonostante questo, Nearwood mantiene un fascino fiabesco che lo rende un'esperienza visivamente incantevole, ideale per chi cerca relax e leggerezza senza troppe pretese.

Voto: 70/100

Game Name: Castle: Never Judge a Book by its Cover
Reviews: Decent game. I skipped one puzzle, which I rarely do, so it has to really suck for me to do that. The storyline was pretty easy and straightforward. the puzzles were hit or miss. story was ok, but a lot of characters, so it got confusing. I've never watched the show and I enjoyed the game just fine. I completed it in one sitting.

Game Name: Small Town Terrors: Pilgrim's Hook Collector's Edition
Reviews: Interesting story, nice gameplay. | It's very good!!!

This was just the perfect game. Had everything I was looking for. A storyline, a mixture of hidden object scenes and thinking games. Once I figured out how to use the map...(Silly me) it went a lot faster then having to click back all the time. 

Not everything is obvious and I had to peek at a few walk throughs to figure one or two things out, but over all it was a good time waster. My son enjoyed watching me play it and helped me as well. 

I will be buying other titles of this as well. I really enjoyed it. | This is the fourth game in this series, and the closest to a sequel of the first game House 1000 Doors: Family Secrets. (I have played all 4 games in the series, in order.)  It is stand alone, as is, but the series storyline might confuse a player as the game briefly refers to previous game adventures in single "throw away/reveal" lines depending on how much of the series storyline is known.

The story: The Palm of Zoroaster, a cursed orb, has been destroying things, people and quite possibly civilizations (or at least, select parts of it) for centuries.  Your job is to destroy the orb.  (No spoilers because there are some if one has been following the series storyline.)  Learn the orb's history, witness its destruction, and of course discover how to destroy it and gather the means to do so.  

The game is set up with an introduction/tutorial, four adventure chapters, and the final conclusive chaper.  I rather like this setup which is different then other HOs with a much more linear storyline.  What changed in this game from the first game (Family Secrets) is the player does not get to choose which adventure to embark on first.  For this game and storyline purposes it is perfect though.  

Hidden object scenes, mixed with some head scratching puzzles and the usual standard puzzles, plus some point and click and a chapter by chapter accumulate and use inventory.  Nothing too hard or tear your hair out challenging.  Game comes with a walkthrough the player can access if they get stuck in game or on a puzzle.  Every puzzle has a skip option and sparkles on needed objects or mini puzzle scene.  Unless playing in Hard mode.  There are three game modes available, in-game achievements, wall papers and a bonus chapter.

Warning: If you are hunting for those elusive extra "hidden/ghost/shape shifting" objects make sure you have them all before leaving the introduction or adventure chapter because you cannot go back once the chapter is finished. (Except in a new game).

Opinion: I like the series, therefore I like each game.  The overall concept is interesting and lends itself to innumberable further games.  The only thing I did not like in this game was the end.  I was expecting a much longer cut scene.  It ended and I thought "Wait, that is it."  The adventure ended, the game ended, but the end felt truncated.  Ah well the bonus chapter made up for the abrupt conclusion. | 系列第二部的点击解密游戏

1、游戏画质还算精致，但过场动画感觉分辨率有些低
不过整个游戏也就500+MB，而且也是好几年前的游戏了
也不能太强求什么

2.故事大概是这样子的
女主角正在帮助调查一起空中圣火事件，根据线索回到了千户之屋
在这里最近同样出现了很多奇怪的事情，比如出现腾飞的火球，墙壁发烫，水无热沸腾
玩家需要做的就是根据获得的道具逐渐解开背后的真相
此名为千户之屋的地方，内部存在通往无数其他国家/地区之门（这一定是任意门！！）
而游戏也正是利用了这些门，分别去到西藏、印度、耶路撒冷、马达加斯加
在每个地区中寻找水晶骷髅然后换取下一个地区的钥匙
最终找到了一切灾害的起源：琐罗亚德斯之掌，并将之摧毁
然而事情还没有结束（完成主剧情后，解锁额外剧情）
屋主加百列告诉我，他并非千户之屋的主人，而是从前任屋主中继承而来
而他现在也即将离世，希望帮助了他2次的主角能接着继承下去
不明真相的我进过一番调查后，发现原来他受到了诅咒，会因此快速老去
当然作为主角的我，并不会见死不救
又经过了一番调查后，终于获得了能够解除诅咒的金苹果
在加百列吃下金苹果后，诅咒终于解除
而游戏剧情也在此结束

3.游戏整体剧情大概8个小时左右
在开始游戏到达第一个场景加油站时可以选择难度
其中普通难度，可以调查的地方都会显示亮光，并提示你要做什么事情
因为游戏也没有成就，所以只是玩剧情的话建议选择这个
没攻略的话基本上也不会太难

4.游戏有内置攻略
在主界面右下角，点开后会有详细的通关步骤
不过整个游戏顺序并不一定要完全按照这个做
游戏当前所有可以触发剧情的地方都会在地图里显示
按照整个提示走也行
唯一需要注意的是，游戏里面的46个超能物品（隐藏物品）
部分是过了后续剧情就没办法再得到的，所以要及时找到

5.有汉化
我是直接下载完后把DataLoc目录覆盖掉就能用了
界面、对话、攻略界面都汉化了 | Evil has taken over at the House of 1,000 Doors since your last visit. It's up to you to travel through dimensions again to save everyone and particularly Gabriel, the protector of it.

This game is the sequel to House of 1,000 Doors: Family Secrets and you'll find some familiar characters, if not everyone from the first game. The plot is also a good written. You're going from China to the jungle, which means many exotic backgrounds for someone who is used to a western city.

The gameplay is the usual one: click on items that you'll need in another scene, solve puzzles, find hidden objects in specific areas, etc.. I found everything well-balanced. Also, you have close-up views in these hidden objects scenes and some objects you can move as they're also hiding items to find.

But what made me love the game, though I've hinted it earlier, is probably the journey through 4 different worlds and meet people that knew about Gabriel - I found it nice that the guy has a background, though it's breaking the charm around this mysterious man (but the more is known in the bonus chapter). And the scenes are really well drawed. You're really transported into other worlds.

The soundtrack is also nice but didn't change from the previous game.

So if you're a fan of HOG, you have to own this game. Besides, there are trading cards with nice emoticons and backgrounds. | ★★★★☆ - hodnocení v rámci žánru Hidden object

Kupoval jsem ve slevě za 1 euro a za tuto cenu mohu doporučit, za plnou cenu nemá smysl, za 10 euro se dají koupit lepší hry.

Poměrně solidní hledačka od ALAWARu, grafika by mohla být malinko lepší (ostřejší), jinak zpracování ok, ozvučení a hudba fajn, příběh ujde. Dohrál jsem za 4 a půl hodinky bez použití HINTů. Není toho moc, co by se dalo hře vytknout, ale ještě tomu něco chybí. HO obrazovky se opakují a předměty také. Velkým kladem je čeština ve hře, ač lze občas najít i lepší překlad (přesnější) pro daný předmět.

bodlo - kord
nahrávka - gramodeska 
dláto - majzlík
věšák - ramínko
kulka - nábojnice
koblížek - donut
hrášek - lusk
olejová lampa - petrolejka

Procházení lokací pomocí mapy je rychlé a bezproblémové. Puzzle minihry ujdou, ale ničím moc nepřekvapí, ve hře jich není ani mnoho. Nemá achievementy, což ubírá na snaze něčeho dosáhnout. Celková hratelnost je ale dobrá, nikde jsem se moc nezdržel, nebo nezaseknul, za mě to na 4 hvězdy má.

+ Čeština
+ Příběhové videosekvence
+ Rychlý pohyb po mapě
+ Bonus po dokončení

- Plná cena (adekvátní bych viděl kolem 3 euro)
- Opakování HO obrazovek a předmětů
- Nemá achievementy

It is a point-and-click adventure game with a psychological horror atmosphere. The combination of polished graphics, atmospheric sound, and challenging puzzles creates a compelling experience. It feels like playing Resident Evil or Silent Hill reimagined as a point-and-click adventure. | Good game very interesting one too both story wise and gane wise | 是以想玩恐怖游戏的初衷看到并选择了玩这款游戏，玩完之后觉得非常满意！作为一款指向点击的解谜游戏，它确实出现过不少吓人的场景，有些也确实狠狠吓到了我，但是总的来说它的恐怖程度还是比较低的（毕竟恐怖部分只是动画和一点点闪现的东西），所以非常适合我这种想玩恐怖游戏但又比较胆小的人~ 
前期会觉得门太多了，真的太多了，走着走着就迷路，但后来来来回回走的实在太多遍了，也就习惯了……也会习惯于使用提示，我的建议是能使用提示的时候就使用提示，这样可以节省很多的时间和避免来来回回漫无目的地走路。因为找线索的过程挺枯燥也挺抽象困难的。
谜题是我比较喜欢的类型，难度也适合我，是需要动脑子的。
越往后剧情会越多，整体玩下来也觉得剧情很有趣，前期的悬疑和铺垫也很有趣。
总结一下，是一款值得推荐的解谜游戏！十分推荐尝试！一定不要前期觉得枯燥困难就退出！不要错过后面的剧情！ | 
マイルドホラーなポイント＆クリック脱出ゲーム。

2015年発売だがシステム面はさらに古く感じる、脱出ゲームなのでこんなものだろうか。
セールで100円以下で買えるので不便承知ならあり。
自分はレトロゲーも遊ぶので全実績解除まで楽しめました。（4.5時間くらいでした、収集漏れはガイドで確認）

どこへ行けばよいかわかりづらいがヘルプ機能の誘導が役に立つ。
謎解きを自力でクリアして4時間弱、ストーリーは薬中？のための施設のようなところからスタート、夢なのか現実なのかふわっとしていてネタバレになるので詳しくは控えるがスッキリしない感じ。
エンディングは2つ（最終盤で分岐）あるがこちらもモヤっとした。結局何だったのか、いやまぁ明らかにはなってるんだけども…

パズル要素としては理不尽なものはなく難しすぎずといったところ、不満点は他のレビューにもあるが移動後の向きがめちゃくちゃ。
扉開けて進んで正面が今入ってきた扉だったり右向いてたり左だったりと、今きたのどっちやねん！？
行ったり来たりするのでそのうち慣れる（というか覚える）がこれはかなり無駄な時間取られた感覚になる。
こっちから来たのに違う部屋だった…ドア通るときにローディングが入る、そして違ったから戻るのにまたローディング。

あえて今やるものでもないが、興味があればセール時にでも。
ちなみに自分は積みゲー崩しでたまたまこのタイミングでプレイでした。
買ったのは多分8年前くらい。 | 剧情特别好，建议玩玩

В общем, прошел игру на одном дыхании за 3.5 часа без длс и могу сказать, что игра очень спокойная и приятная. Ламповая атмосфера и спокойная музыка снимет с вас накопленный стресс и расслабит как подобает.
Рекомендация для прохождения: играть в 3 часа ночи с приглушённым светом и обязательно, обязательно повысьте громкость для улучшения релакса. Удачной охоты... | [h1] Outlast [/h1]
[h2] Score: 8/10 [/h2]

If you're like me then you absolutely love watching these lost place and urban explorer videos. Likely, you have also seen such a video on an abandoned hospital or perhaps even an asylum. If so, you're already pretty well prepared, because this time it's not empty or abandoned; quite the other way around. Outlast, released back in 2013 by Red Barrels delivers a combination of these sorts of videos and horror. 

Taking on the role of a daring journalist, you head out to Mount Massive Asylum, out in the middle of nowhere. Armed with nothing but a whistleblower document, informing you about the horrific human experiments supposedly taking place inside the asylum, and your trusty camcorder, equipped with a night vision mode. This camcorder is the heart of the game and what makes it stand out. You will witness almost the entirety of the game through the screen of that thing, making it feel like a collection of found footage. You'll need the night vision to navigate the dark areas of the Asylum, which will burn your battery life, so collecting AA batteries is a top priority. 

Outlast is less of a game and more of a test of your fight-or-flight response - think of it more as hide-and-seek game on the hardest difficulty. Except the seeker is a bloodthirsty lunatic and there is no happy ever after if they happen to find you. You can't fight back; you either run away or hide, or accept your fate, and that's where the beauty of this game lies. It lies in those hopeless moments you run away from a group of lunatics, not knowing where to go and asking yourself "what next?". It's hiding behind a desk and debating on if it's better to stay hidden or just send it. Those moments when you're perfectly thought out plan fails and the chase music starts playing, your heart pounding as you run aimlessly through the halls trying to shake off your pursuer.

The gameplay is what kept dragging me back into this horrible Asylum. The rush of adrenaline when you see something glowing in the corner of your camcorder, in the darkest possible place, and have to ask yourself if it was an enemy or nothing. This game lives from the sections of the game that are not scripted. Those sections that change every playthrough due to the AI's and your own behaviour. It's extremely immersive and strong enough to make you forget that it's all just a clever combination of 1s and 0s on a screen. 

The game is split up into 3 (4, counting cutscenes) major gameplay elements.

1) Exploring 
Usually the most atmospheric, and serve as breather sections. You find documents that elaborate the lore, recharge your camcorder using batteries and witness the still horrors of the asylum.

2) Chase
Intense yet scripted chases. They give you a good kick most of the time and make you feel desperate. They're extremely well made using little tricks that keep the tension high. Like climbing, squeezing through gaps, or my favorite, doors that open toward you. 

3) Freeroam Objectives
Intense but sadly very repetitive. You are set out into a wider, open area with a set of goals and an enemy. Like, for example, turning the power back on, which requires switching on three seperate levers. These are genuinely great, since like mentioned before, the way these go down change practically everytime depending on your playstyle and the AI's tendencies. 

Some other noteworthy things to praise are the length, story/atmosphere and especially soundtrack. The game doesn't overstay its welcome and ends in about 3-5 hours. Which is a pretty good length. It stops before it gets repetitive. 

Outlast's atmosphere is crazy good. Thanks to the soundtrack and just general atmospheric work. The camcorder records every bit of dust in the air, the sounds are great, you almost always hear distant screams and cries, steps or people banging on doors. Every chapter has a distinct environment and i feel has a nice creative twist; like the dark sewers, where your every step in the water can be heard, or the prison, where you'll be nice and close to all these lunatics in their cells. Additionally, this shit is also (almost) entirely based on a true story! So if you're interested, you can do some research on the game's topics after you finish. It's worth it. And whether you are slowly stepping around the foggy courtyard, or being chased by the big fat guy, the soundtrack perfectly illustrates these moments. Seriously, the soundtrack deserves a michelin star and is overlooked so often.

Sadly, when there is no apparent enemy around, the game does rely heavily on jumpscares to keep the horror part alive. These.. are fine but a) you only fall for them once and b) they are all verryyy similar. You're almost always jumped at by a patient accompanied by an over the top scream. But it also has some genius scares that i wont go into ;).

Over all, i think even 11 years after launch it's still well worth it. Though not at full price, get it at a discount. Like most games it's usually on sale about every 1-2 months. It'll definitely keep you entertained and occupied for a while.

Игра с первых минут переносит в прекрасное время 1 курса медицинского университета, когда староста 500 раз объяснила, где находится кабинет, но ты все равно потерялся и не понимаешь куда идти в огромном здании универа. Дальше игра неожиданно переносит тебя на первые пары нормальной и патологической анатомии, когда ходишь мимо учебных препаратов, шарахаясь, вдруг кто-то из них все еще живой и сейчас прыгнет на тебя. Но наибольшее удовольствие приносят флешбеки с кафедры психиатрии, когда преподаватель оставил вашу группу одних в отделении и ты всеми силами избегаешь взглядов и разговоров с пациентами, а иначе придется повторить судьбу Вейлона Парка... | 10/10 game. Very scary.

A lil backstory... I got this game for the first time back in 2022, but I was so freaked out that I ended up refunding it. Decided to give it another shot and repurchased it… well, now I can’t refund it because I accidentally crossed the 2 hour mark. So, I’m stuck playing this game.

Now, coming to the game... It scares the crap out of me. It took me about 17 hours just to get to the sewers chapter, and that’s on normal mode. The fear factor has definitely stretched out the playtime. I’m guessing it’ll take me another 20 hours to reach the end. I’m not sure if I’ll finish the game or if the game will finish me.

🥖 Well, it's not as fun as «Surgeon Simulator» or even «Goat», but the idea is definitely crazy, backed by a fairly simple story. Obviously, it's a bit of a "rage game", because physics don't play a big role in funny sims, but it's important here and at the same time can be bad. However, being a YT's title, ordinary players haven't really even tried to complete it (if you check the achievements). In fact, ~70% of them can be easily unlocked in under 5h, without any guides, but if most didn't even bother to complete the short seven-level campaign, it's not surprising that the game is relatively forgotten. So long, toast, only crazy people will do your time trials for platinum, and for the rest — the game was just okay. | esse jogo eh pessimo, alem de ser completamente bugado e mal renderizado alguns do objetivos sao quase impossiveis frustrando os jogadores antes sequer de passar de fase ainda mais pela pessima escolha de teclas do teclado, so compre se vc gostar de ser irritar pagando, avisa | Мало кто знал, но у этой игры есть второй уровень

Game Name: Game of Thrones - A Telltale Games Series
Reviews:
What has to be one of the most miserable, disappointing and pointless games out there. Almost every episode builds up to something that is quickly resolved in the most awful way imaginable or just goes nowhere. Choices matter even less than usual with this one, too. Even if you're a big GoT fan like I am, waiting for GRRM to finish those books or Chinese water torture might be a more enjoyable use of your time. | Finally finished this miserysimulator after forcing myself to play it. Most choices dont seem to matter and just leads to the characters getting punished, humiliated or killed. The creators clearly thought that what makes Game of thrones is just alot of misery and carnage and little else. I'm glad this is over so I can uninstall and try to forget. | Game of Thrones: A Telltale Game Series – A Tale of Betrayal (Both in Story and Development, and Also in Availability)
If there’s one thing Game of Thrones taught us, it’s that life is cruel, unfair, and no one is safe. Fittingly, Game of Thrones: A Telltale Game Series delivers that same gut-punch—not just in its story, but in the fact that it ends on a massive cliffhanger that will never be resolved because of the ill-fated collapse of Telltale Games.

But hey, that doesn’t really matter anymore—because you can’t even buy it on Steam. Like so many characters in Game of Thrones, this game was brutally erased from existence, delisted from the store with no chance of return. Unless you already own it or find some alternative means of playing, it’s as good as gone.

Not that you'd be missing much in terms of agency. Telltale was famous for making you feel like your choices mattered, but let’s be honest—they don’t. No matter how cunning or careful you are, the story mostly funnels you down the same miserable path, with only minor differences in who dies now versus who dies later. It’s Game of Thrones, after all—everyone loses eventually.

And yet, despite all that, it’s still an engaging ride. The writing, voice acting, and atmosphere feel authentic to the show, and the tension keeps you invested—right up until the final episode drops a brutal cliffhanger that will never be answered.

Would I recommend it? Not like it matters—you can’t buy it anyway. | L’œuvre de Georges Martin a connu son heure de gloire à la télévision, et Telltale vous invite à plonger dedans. Vous allez passer une douzaine d’heures en compagnie des principaux membres de la famille Forrester, petite famille au service de la Maison Stark, et soumise à l’autorité des WhiteHills, sur l’ordre de la Maison Bolton. Un jeu très dangereux d’intrigue, de soumission, de complot et d’honneur se met en place. Parviendrez-vous à garder la tête haute et bien accrochée à vos épaules ?

Vous revivrez quelques moments parmi les plus décisifs de la série HBO, et voir des visages très connus, doublés par les comédiens officiels. Et dans la peau de l’un ou l’autre des Forrester, vous devrez prendre les bonnes décisions pour rester en vie et empêcher la chute de votre Maison.

L’atmosphère est très réussie, comme d’habitude chez ce studio, on s’y croirait. Mais une chose m’embête : le jeu prétend faire évoluer l’histoire selon les décisions du joueur. Or, si effectivement il vous fera faire de nombreux choix, vous verrez que vous n’aurez que l’illusion d’avoir un choix alors que vous n’aurez pas le choix. Ainsi, vous aurez l’impression de voir l’histoire se contorsionner pour qu’il arrive un événement en particulier alors que vous aurez tout fait pour éviter cet événement. C’est un parti pris frustrant.

Considérez ce jeu plus comme une série spin off, et tout ira bien. | Ayant fait ce jeu avant d'avoir vu le moindre épisode de Game of Thrones, je peux dire qu'une connaissance de la série ou des livres n'est pas requise.
On reste ici dans la lignée des jeux Telltale Games de cette époque.
Les différents épisodes sont assez plaisants. Les personnages sont nombreux et je pense que l'ADN de l'œuvre originale est plutôt adapté à ce style de jeu à choix, même si, comme d'habitude, les choix n'ont au final que peu d'impact. Cela fonctionne tout de même au niveau de l'immersion.
Je mettrais ce Game of Thrones plutôt dans le panier haut des productions du studio dans le genre du récit interactif (que je distingue des point & click comme Sam & Max de leur première période).

Wadjet Eye Games once again delivers a decent product.
A simple story with good writing, grounded characters with nice voice and smart puzzles.

A post-apocalyptic world going through the usual genre cliches, but hey,
it is still very endearing as we live through the perspective of a simple but ingenious citizen.
There are no magic, mutants or demons in this game. Just the good old post-apolacypse setting.

The puzzles were surprisingly logical and well designed,
meaning no insane moon logic or developer tunnel vision (as is common in the genre). Quite Enjoyable!
(Everyday I thank we don't get another Sierra or Lucasarts game..)

From what I read, the ending was polarizing for some but I liked it.
How it tested where your ideologies stand, good thing I got the "good" ending.


Shardlight is a decent entry.
I liked it. | Great pixel art, voice acting, puzzles. Would recommend! | A beautifully grim take on the post-apocalyptic, [u]Shardlight[/u] excels at the key aspects of point-and-click adventures. The story is dark and compelling, and I always knew how to progress. The characters are intriguing; I felt sad for the good ones and righteous when the villains got their due. The puzzles challenged me, but I enjoyed solving them. The voice acting, especially the protagonist, stood out. If you liked [u]Technobabylon[/u], I highly recommend this game. | Приведу этот обзор и на английском тоже. I will give this review in English too.
Игры от Дэйва Гилберта (Уаджет Ай) и Франциско Гонсалеса (Грундислав Геймс) стали для меня давно знаком качества и невероятно интересного приключения, глубоких и серьезных историй. Эта игра не стала исключением, но заняла особое место. Легкая ностальгия и грусть, как будто в поисках важного утраченного, попытках его вернуть и исправить, присуща юной героине Эми, страдающей от серьезного заболевания, которой необходимо собрать все силы и решить массу вопросов как для себя, так и для спасения будущего, вникнуть в политические интриги, поднять для себя вопрос веры - во что и насколько сильно, и вместе с иными героями игры пройти длинную дорогу. Качественный пиксель и интересные квесты не дают скучать, игра длинная и увлекающая за собой во вселенную альтернативного будущего, которое возможно очень близко...Браво создателям!
The games from Dave Gilbert (Wadget Eye) and Francisco Gonzalez (Grundislav Games) have become familiar to me for a long time and incredibly interesting adventures, historical and serious stories. This game was no exception, but it occupied a special place. A slight nostalgia and sadness, as if in search of an important lost thing, trying to return and correct it, is inherent in the young heroine Amy, suffering from a serious illness, who needs to gather all her strength and solve a lot of issues both for herself and to save the future. delve into political intrigues, raise the question of faith - what and how much, and, together with other heroes of the game, go a long way. High-quality pixels and interesting quests do not let you get bored, the game is long and takes you into the universe of an alternative future, which may be very close...Bravo to the creators!

Really enjoyed this game. Will have to get the other Wadjet Eye games as well, I believe this is the first one I've played by them but this was really well done. Gameplay wise it's a pretty simple point and click game, kind of a streamlined version of the old school point and click games, which I liked.

Story was very good, the voice acting was excellent and for me is what really brought everything together. After playing through several times, this game is more like a good book that you get to know the characters, was a bit sad to reach the ending the first time, but the story was nicely wrapped up. Hopeful for a sequel still, even though it's been several years. | Curto, mas profundo. Trata histórias com maturidade e de forma extremamente criativa. Recomendação absoluta para qualquer um que gosta de mistério. | Started kinda slow, but really picked up.

It has a pretty good story and a good ability to make impactful choices.

Although it was mostly simple, there were some creative challenges that made it enjoyable. | A real demonstration of what this engine can do. Great writing and beautiful visuals, truly top Dave Gilbert and Wadjeteye work.

[b]An intimate diary tribute to the 10th anniversary of Max’s journey.[/b]

It used to be a tradition for me to play [i]Life is Strange[/i] every New Year’s Eve when visiting my childhood home. So many memories intertwine with it. Jumping up and down on the bed losing my mind after the 3Ep twist. Bugging my classmates with a basket of theories and insane lore about the game's development. Cutting my hair slowly bit by bit until it eventually resembled Max's. I learned Spanish Sahara by heart and played it non-stop on the ukulele I begged my parents to buy. Even the wall of my room was decorated in Max's style – a tradition I carry to all the homes, or the resemblance of homes, I've changed along the way. In 11th grade, I made Max’s journal from scratch, it was one of my favorite pieces in the room, taking a notable place among my own personal and school diaries. I remember playing the 4th episode on a school week until 6am and going straight to school all hyped and simultaneously out of it. When Episode 5 came out, I sobbed for two weeks! My best friend at that time and I woke up so early that day, purposefully missed school, and spent all day immersed in that final chapter – her watching a live stream and I cursing at my old computer unable to handle Max’s time jumping shenanigans; of course, taking occasional breaks for comparing our declining emotional stability. [i]Life is Strange[/i] carried me from that final school year straight to University, helping me figure out some stuff about my own life along the way; as it did to many. Every time I turn it on now it just turns into a crying fest. From love, of course. But also sorrow.

Over the years, I’ve read so many players' intimate recollections prompted by the game's content; random snippets of people’s most vulnerable life stories sprinkled over each social media platform. Simply something awoken in people of all ages and backgrounds, perhaps by the game’s mellow nostalgic aesthetics and unabashed willingness to attune to the finest memories and emotions of our hearts. It was rather pleasant to witness the resurgence of [i]LiS[/i] fandom in late 2024, collectively reminiscing on our intimate interaction with the story, the newfound change in perspectives, and the passionate desire to mutually share all the warmth we still have for its characters. 

Living through Max was foundational for me, a self-conscious girl growing into confident adulthood with innocence violently ripped away from her. It was simply an average coming-of-age process, growing up and seeing a world from a different perspective, learning to connect and empathize with those around, learning from them and finding our own flaws and desires, recognizing them and growing to be better. But also a darker experience of going through my own sexual assault, of losing my own innocence, shifting and modifying the self to perhaps be more cynical and pragmatic, of maybe seeing the world through a darker yet necessary lens. Yet, ultimately, all of it forming one unified identity that is nevertheless a beautiful landscape of variable experiences and lessons; adulthood. I will always love the character of Max dearly. I will always cry noticing the gradual change of her vibrant diary doodles to objective, subdued in color entries with each passing chapter. I will always cry for the innocent love Max finds in non-innocent circumstances. The exploration of Max’s fractured mind following the violation will always mean the world to me, back in 2015 making me feel seen and motivated to start my own tumultuous journey of healing. I will always be grateful for Don’t Nod creating this beloved gamified companion to project our own internal worries onto, our transformations, and dreams; to reach intimate answers through a bittersweet, meditative experience.

[i]Life is Strange[/i] maintains sheer gratitude and wonder for each part of our environment while not rejecting the truth of the shadows stretching over the world’s corners. Finding beauty in the industrial powers of small towns, their nature, expansion in infrastructure, transformation of beliefs, unique differing people, and their interconnected messy ties to each other: as colleagues, students, friends, lovers. Finding beauty in the contrast of lives cut short, resentments, domestic disputes, destructive truths, violence, and uncertainty of tomorrow. Creating a living, breathing town that wishes to continuously evolve, grow, and adapt to the changing population making up its geographical landscape. Rachel Amber’s character is perhaps the most compassionate interpretation of Laura Palmer’s image I have seen, Chloe’s uncensored journey of clawing through grief calls to the most helpless moments of my own 19old self, and the understanding of violence captured in a human-shaped form still wounds me deeply: of course, so much of [i]LiS[/i] was inspired by and carried love for David Lynch’s legacy.


It's not so much the content of media; over time it becomes something bigger than its key narrative points. Rather, the events it accompanied in life, the memories you associate it with. That's when stories become truly dear to the heart no matter the years passed. It simply evokes a subdued feeling, like a thread granting the privilege to time travel to your own thoughts, memories, tastes, smells, relationships, places.

I tried replaying this game in so many locations now it can be drawn onto a map, like a shi+ty road trip. But I never lasted very long, about 30 minutes before I lose my cool completely and start thinking of the hand-drawn picturesque walls of my school. Of the captured memories sprinkled over my walls. Of the path to my home from school, from my friends, from the center, from my mom's job, from the park, from the waterfront. Of the last school days and giving away my books. Of getting closer with my classmates and finally understanding how similar we are. Of looking out my window, the windows of my friends, the windows of my school – and seeing sunsets, sunrises, golden hours, whirlwinds, blizzards, screeching hot days. Of dark days. Of town spots I avoid. Of town spots I wish could stay with me. A living breathing town… trapped in hazy, fleeting pieces of memory. Out of reach, a resemblance of something that used to be, overwritten by new places and people – when it's one of the last anchors you have to that past you cannot go back to. Learning to hold the value of delicate memory, accept darkness, and cherish its lighter undertones.

Finally replaying the game after these years, I’ve been finding new connections with Arcadia Bay, of the radical shift it makes from a nostalgic warm town to a harbor of ruin. How it strongly encompasses both, yet neither. I’ve been thinking of how the geography of my town has been modified, its prior identity forever wiped away. I’ve been countering the grief of losing childhood physically and emotionally with the fleeting traces of glee that used to be. On dark days, I will always hold on to the memory of sitting on the hot-to-the-touch boulder stone with my childhood friend, giggling about our new life developments, surrounded by forestry of a quiet park and bright sun. Of looking around me and seeing kids become more expressive in their identities, unafraid to look, think, and love however they please. Of regularly visiting my school and checking in to see if the asphalt drawing we made in dedication to our class teacher has faded away, or the chamomiles covering the school’s entrance are still greeting the children. Of peaking outside from the large plants covering my mom’s windowsill and seeing the rose we have planted outside slowly rise and bloom. Of always having a prepared 2h15m playlist to accompany me on the trip to my town from the nearby big city.

Nowadays, [i]Life is Strange[/i] transports me to the hot summer days of my home. 
I will always be grateful for having a chance to time travel. | I've been wondering for a long time whether "Life is Strange" is a game I could recommend or not, since it has very positive reviews and a slew of fans. I also expected such an experience. Unfortunately, I have to admit that the game disappointed me. Don't get me wrong, I fell in love with the demo version (chapter one), which promised an elaborate crime story with several suspects and lots of decision-making. We were introduced to the characters along with our heroine (Max), as she was new to the school. It promised a story full of excitement, mystery and consequences of our choices.

Unfortunately, after purchasing the full version of the game, with all the chapters (21 hours played), the spell faded in several different ways:

1. The game turned out to be a delusion of the consequences of the choices (except for the final decision at the end - although this one is disappointing in terms of the logic of the choice and the realization of the consequences, especially in the case of one final).
 
2. The game deliberately distracts us from some characters, completely forgetting them as criminal suspects. Because of this, we are unable to gather evidence in their case. Which is then supposed to cause surprise, shock, etc. - A cheap, ineffective ploy.

3. Overly cinematic final chapters. At one point in the game, there was so much story told in interludes and stills that for most of the chapter, the player had nothing to do but minor linear activities that contributed nothing. This killed my immersion and and even more my sense of control and decision-making.

4. Little bugs. The ending cutscenes have a number of close-ups of characters talking without their mouths moving. There are so many of them that at some point it becomes uncomfortable. The time reversal system is also sometimes unintuitive and can erase a decision even though it was not intended.

**[Warning: little spoilers]**

5. Final decisions: It is supposed to arouse emotions, but whether it does so is not necessarily the case. The first ending looks good and emotional, but the second one is dull and bland. In addition, it shows that everything we did throughout the game is irrelevant to our protagonist Max (all the friendships we've made, the lives we saved, etc.). That's not how you write good endings.

6. Imbalance in the characterization of the characters. Just as most of the characters are good written (they have their own motives, secrets, behaviors and are believable), I cannot say the same about two of the main characters who should arouse sympathy - Chloe and (maybe) Warren.
The friendship between Max and Chloe is, in my opinion, completely one-sided. Chloe uses Max's skills like a toy, she doesn't accept criticism, she's explosive and I didn't get the impression that she actually cared about her friend or even respected her, her character and way of being. Thus, he forces her to engage in various activities, even though Max points out that such activities are not to her liking or even can hurt her. Despite this, Max keeps repeating wonderful words about lifelong friendship and can also create a love bond with her. The only positive aspect of Chloe's character is at the end, when she realizes all these elements and talks about them, and makes her first unselfish decision.
As for Warren, he's written strangely. He's supposed to be a geek with a crush on Max, and he basically is, but throughout the entire game I had the impression that there was something strange about him and that he was hiding something. | 沉浸感无敌，剧情不拖泥带水，就是克洛伊像个啥币，看后续剧情发展吧 | This is one of the best video game stories ever told – a true classic. If you haven’t played it yet, make sure to carve out some time for it; it’s totally worth it!
 |   Jogo muito especial, amo jogos com pequenos detalhes importantes, e esse com certeza é um deles, TRILHA SONORA INCRÍVEL, história muito boa mesmo, amo os personagens e os desenvolvimentos durante o jogo, você fica imerso demais na história e vale a pena cada segundo

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG
Reviews:
方舟一直都是我心目中的生存游戏天花板，21年用着一台很破烂的手机接触方舟虽然只有是十几帧，但是很快乐，22年放暑假的时候用着姐姐核显笔记本玩，直接卡到爆炸闪退，但是体验到手游与端游的差距后，立志要买一台不卡电脑开最高画质玩，23年放暑假用自己凑了很久的钱在咸鱼上买二手零件组装了一台R5 5500cpu,显卡RX590玩，但还是很卡，低画质六十帧都没有，于是我开始慢慢节约开销，一点点省下来，25年1月份我用这些钱买了一台搭载I7 14650hx和4070显卡的笔记本，我开着最高画质玩，我完成了我儿时的心愿，没有遗憾，现在是我人生中最快乐的时候，不说了，方舟生存启动！ | 作为沙盒生存史上最伟大游戏之一的ARK，只能说喜欢的人玩几千个小时都不腻，玩不进去的基本很早就退坑了，其原因无非就是不喜欢恐龙元素或者是游戏难度问题，这款游戏给我个人的感觉就是前期坐牢，中期最好玩，后期爽，大后期就会非常腻，一般这种时候就该换地图了，或者是玩点别的游戏缓解一下，等过段时间再继续体验会更合适，本人1000小时+，大多数时间都是自己单机，偶尔多人联机，人多其实才更好玩，当然这也得分情况，pvp很容易让人红温是真事，但是比起单机更不容易玩腻，可操作性会多很多，pve会玩的更舒服一些，在此极力推荐刚入坑或者会坑的新人们先去单机玩孤岛（island）这张初始地图熟悉一下各类操作和恐龙，即时是玩最简单的这张地图，新手前期也是最难度过的时候，坚持下来了你就是下一位大佬，撑不住那我还是劝你换别的游戏，玩游戏还是开心最重要，没必要折磨自己，但是我当初前期的时候也非常享受，因为我觉得探索新事物是最有趣的，现在的我已经逐渐套路化，感觉再也没有当初一开始的那种感觉了，虽然说我不会退坑，但是基本上也没啥新的体验了，还是祝各位玩家玩的痛快吧，痛苦并快乐着，不说了继续刷材料 | This game is not perfect by any means. Programming wise, not particularly well omtimized. Bugs still happen, creatures do weird stuff etc. With that in mind, I fucking love this game. I have met so many great people and communities with this. Been with it since before breeding was a thing. I've had laughs, cries, love and heartbreak. And all the dinosaurs. All the adventures. The long nights fooling around in this world. Many hours, such worth, very good. Absolutely worth it. | ---{Gráficos}---

Game Name: ARK: The Survival Of The Fittest
Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy
Reviews:
It's criminal that this game is still being sold, considering that the servers are seemingly permanently down. | [h1] ARK: The Survival of the Fittest – мёртворождённый эксперимент [/h1]

Когда разработчики ARK: Survival Evolved решили вписаться в жанр королевских битв, казалось, что идея неплохая: битвы с динозаврами, приручение прямо в бою, выживание против других игроков – всё это могло бы стать чем-то уникальным. Но реальность оказалась печальнее.

[h2] ✅ Что в игре хорошего: [/h2]
✔ В теории – интересная концепция (если закрыть глаза на исполнение).
✔ Динозавры в королевской битве – звучит круто, но только звучит.

[h2] ❌ Почему в это никто не играет: [/h2]
✖ Мёртвая с момента выхода – онлайн просто нет, даже боты бы не стали заходить в эту игру.
✖ Кривой баланс – если ты не оседлал Т-Рекса в первые минуты, то готовься стать кормом для тех, кто успел.
✖ Отвратительная оптимизация – просадки FPS, лаги, баги, как будто движок и сам не хочет, чтобы эта игра существовала.
✖ Никому не нужна – на фоне других королевских битв вроде PUBG, Apex Legends или даже фанатских серверов в оригинальном ARK эта игра просто не имеет смысла.

Это не просто провал – это игра, которая умерла ещё до того, как кто-то всерьёз в неё поверил разработчик. С таким же успехом можно попробовать сыграть в PUBG на выключенном мониторе – хотя бы нервы целее будут.

2 из 10 покинутых серверов. | ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is the ultimate test of survival where it’s not just about fighting dinosaurs—it’s about surviving in a world where everything, from the weather to the creatures to your fellow players, is out to get you. Picture this: you’re dropped into an island with nothing but your wits, some rocks, and a stick, and you’ve got to figure out how to stay alive while dodging massive carnivores and attempting to avoid becoming someone else’s dinner. Add in some players who think they’re the island’s top predator (spoiler: they’re not), and suddenly, your quest to survive turns into an all-out, hilarious game of “who can mess with who first?” Trust me, it’s intense, but also surprisingly fun when you realize you’re a second away from being eaten by a T-Rex and you somehow make it out alive. That’s when the real fun begins!

At its heart, ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is a battle royale-style game set in a prehistoric world, filled with dangers both natural and player-made. The basic premise? You, along with other players, are dropped onto a hostile island where you must gather resources, craft weapons, tame dinosaurs, and try to survive long enough to become the last one standing. The twist? You’ll need to strategize, team up, or even betray others to outsmart and outlast the competition. It’s not just about surviving the creatures; it’s about surviving the players too. Tame some raptors, build traps, create defenses, and get ready for combat because the last survivor on the island wins. Oh, and don’t forget about the giant mutant spiders and those terrifying, unkillable bosses roaming around. In short, everything wants you dead, and you have to be smarter, stronger, and faster to avoid becoming dinner.

What really stands out about ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is the blend of survival mechanics, strategy, and chaotic multiplayer action. The vast array of creatures you can tame and use in combat adds layers of complexity to the gameplay. The game rewards strategic thinking, from deciding when to team up with others (and when to stab them in the back) to figuring out the best way to hunt or avoid the island’s mega-predators. The crafting system is deep, and the thrill of gathering materials to build your base and weapons while fending off enemy tribes is incredibly satisfying. If you’re into survival games with a high stakes, high tension environment where every decision counts—and where a single mistake could lead to an epic failure—ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is a must-try. It’s perfect for anyone who loves a challenge, epic dino battles, and the thrill of outlasting other players in a hostile environment. Trust me, it’s chaos—and it’s absolutely worth diving into! | sera que volverán los servidores alguna vez??? | Игра просто бомба от слова совсем! Я скачал ее в 4 время уже 9 до сих пор не могу оторваться. Только жалко то что играет не особо много людей человек 10 а так имба! Всем советую. Если у вас кучу времени и нервов то эта игра вам подойдет.

I really am enjoying Pixel Puzzles, it's one of those games that kind of sneaks up on you and turns out to be much more fun than you expected.  While it is a free game with downloadable content in the form of extra puzzles there is plenty in the base game to keep you busy and the new content is pretty good and certainly adds to the game.  Would recommend this for anyone that is a fan of jigsaw puzzles, puzzles in general or just wants to play something a little different. | [h1]🎮 [u]Pixel Puzzles Ultimate[/u] 🎮[/h1]

Decaying Logic gelingt es auf einfache Art und Weise das beste Jigsaw-Puzzle-Game auf Steam zu betreiben. Ich sage bewusst betreiben, denn die Zahl der Erweiterungen steigt stetig und die monatlichen Challenges können durchaus als Community orientiertes Weiterentwicklen betrachtet werden. Es ersetzt natürlich kein echtes Puzzle, das Aufräumen entfällt aber und so viel Platz nimmt es auch nicht weg. Das Basisspiel bietet derweil nicht all zu viele Puzzle, lässt einen aber einen kostenlosen Einblick in die Mechanik gewinnen. Dabei wird von Seiten der Entwickler eigentlich alles richtig gemacht. Übersichtliches Menü, einfache Bedienung, attraktive Features.

[b]Features[/b]

Für das abschließen von Puzzles gibt es neben den Errungenschaften auch "goldene Puzzleteile" und während dem puzzlen kann man "Hints" finden. Mit den Hints lassen sich beim puzzlen Hilfestellungen anfordern (richtige Rotation eines Puzzleteils, genauer Ort eines Puzzleteils & kurzer Blick auf das Gesamtbild) oder 50 Stück können in ein goldenes Teil umgewandelt werden. Mit goldenen Puzzleteilen lassen sich Items im Kiosk freischalten. Von Zeit zu Zeit gibt es auch Events, wo für das Abschließen eines Puzzles doppelt so viele goldene Teile vergeben werden.

Decaying Logic hat mit dem erwähnten Kiosk ein Feature implementiert, welches als Langzeitmotivation angesehen werden kann. Neben kosmetischen Items zur Individualisierung des Spiels (Cursor, Musik, Themes), lassen sich auch sogenannte "Uniques", d.h. besonders schwere oder aufwendige Puzzle freischalten. Dazu können die bereits angesprochenen goldenen Puzzleteile verwendet werden. Auch alte Challenges lassen sich auf diesem Weg noch spielen.

Die monatlichen Challenges sind ein weiterer Pluspunkt bei der Entwicklung. Kostenlos und äußerst anspruchsvoll, lassen sie den Puzzle-Fan schon die ein oder andere Stunde vor dem PC verbringen. Die Motivwahl ist dafür auch sehr unterschiedlich, wobei die Farbnuancen und die Puzzle-Form der Einzelteile einen zuweilen zur Weißglut treiben. Bei erfolgreichem Abschluss erhält man ein sogenanntes "Ultimate Piece", welches auch im Kiosk eingelöst werden kann. 

[b]Die DLCs[/b]

Ohne Packs wirkt das Spiel recht leer. Wer bereits die anderen Spiele der Pixel Puzzles-Serie erwerben konnte oder sie bei einer der etlichen Promotionsaktionen kostenlos erhielt, der kann sie bei der Ultimate-Version nochmals spielen. Auch das ein oder andere DLC kann noch kostenlos im Netz gefunden werden, wie bspw. DaVinci oder Beach Volleyball, sodass man eine doch schon recht große Auswahl an Puzzlen (ca. 100) von Beginn an haben kann. Es bedarf aber etwas Arbeit im Vorfeld!

Die DLCs scheinen auf den ersten Blick natürlich überteuert, jedoch erhält man für die Preise i.d.R. guten Content. Für 0,99€ kann man dann, je nach Erfahrung, mehrere Stunden mit puzzlen verbringen. Wartet man auf einen Sale, rentiert es sich erst recht. Bewertet habe ich jedoch nur all jene DLCs, welche regulär mehr als 4,99 Euro kosten. Dies wären "[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Xeeran/recommended/591508/]Spanien[/url][/i]", "[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Xeeran/recommended/591502/]China[/url][/i]" und "[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Xeeran/recommended/589651/]Pin-Ups[/url][/i]".

[b]Fazit[/b]

Das Spiel bietet jedem Puzzle-Fan eine platzsparende und gute Alternative zu herkömmlichen Puzzlen. Wer in Pixel Puzzles Ultimate nur einen teuren Jigsaw-Puzzler sieht, den er auch kostenlos im Netz haben könnte, der verkennt die Vorzüge. Ein Test kann nicht schaden, weshalb ich auch nichts zur Mechanik sagte und sollte die meisten Interessierten überzeugen können. Denn dort gibt es keine Beanstandung. Einzig die Musik nervt, doch mute und Radio schaffen abhilfe!

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32139821-German-Review-Group/list/39268/]Liste kostenlos spielbarer Titel, bewertet durch die German Review Group[/url]

[i]Wenn ihr an weiteren Rezensionen von mir interessiert seid oder meine Arbeit unterstützen wollt, dann folgt meiner [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ger_steam]Gruppe[/url] und/oder der [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/875292/]Kuration[/url][/i]. | Бесплатная игра классических пазлов. Условно бесплатная. Бесплатного контента хватит не надолго, за остальное придётся очень сильно раскошеливаться. Картинки в большинстве своём для сбора не интересные, а зачастую вообще откровенно уродливые. Такое впечатление, что разработчик ходит по рынку изображений и откладывает в корзину всё самое захудалое,  что людям стыдно продавать дороже чем даром. А ведь можно было бы набрать шикарных фотографий, но нет. Гниль всякая ближе к сердцу.  Количество кусочков в пазле никак не регулируется и находится в ведении злой фантазии разработчика. Как его левая нога возжелает, так и будете собирать. Захочет - будете 1000 кусков собирать, а захочет - только шестьдесят.

Я долго следила за развитием этой игры и убедилась, что его нет. Баги и недорзумения как были, так и остаются, неудобства и нелепости игрового процесса как были так и остаются. Но зато стабильно клепаются всё новые и новые DLC. Причём по совершенно конским ценам, словно я на фотостоке покупаю эксклюзивную лицензию на эти изображения.  И с чего бы вообще им столько стоить? Всё же по накатанной, покупка изображений по копеечным ценам, программное разбиение их на кусочки и всё. Алгоритм давно написан, интерфейс тоже. Дел на пять минут. Вы одной своей покупкой дополнения за полную цену окупите все затраты разработчика на годы вперёд.  Фантастическое рвачество.

При этом долбаных карпов и лотосы я должна принудительно отключать каждый раз, когда гружу пазл, даже если вышла из него на минуточку, возвращаешься и опять эта помойка плавает. Кому она вообще нужна? Что за дурная идея это всё вообще сделать?  
Картинка-превью по-прежнему микроскопическая и её нельзя увеличить, что бы рассмотреть подробнее. Так она ещё и обрезана по краям. Резать-то её зачем? 
Этот фильтр на фотоизображения зачем применять. Для чего я должна видеть эту размазню на кусочек пазла вместо чёткой картинки, по которой бы можно было нормально определить откуда этот кусок? Чисто из пакости души?
Почему при выборе опции "играть в окне", не только скудный набор нелепых разрешений, но и окно не разворачивается во весь экран? Это кривые мозги не позволяют сделать полноценное окно, или опять же, гниль за грудиной?
Почему до сих пор нельзя поменять цвета подложки для поля временного размещения избранных кусочков? Кусочки тёмного цвета туда откладывать вообще бесполезно, их на чёрном фоне не разглядеть. Казалось бы, простая функция, для других полей игры реализовано. А тут что, религия сильно против?
А какой извращенец придумал эту системы подбора кусочков? В какой больной ум пришла мысль, что когда я тыкаю мышью в свалку кусочков, то мне нужен не верхний, который я вижу, а нижний или какой-нибудь из середины? Пол-минуты можно потратить, пока наконец к мыши не прицепится тот самый кусочек, который я вижу и хочу взять. Пока докликаешься до него, вот уже и играть перехотелось.
Так же по-уродски сделан и поворот. То на 90 градусов повернётся, то на 180, сиди убивай нервы на попытке повернуть кусок в нужное положение.

Остальную кучу нелепостей и неудобств даже перечислять не стану. Хватает их, но начинать надо с вышеперечисленного.

В общем и целом, отзыв мой отрицательный, хотя игра в целом работоспособна, но рвачество и отсутствие желания довести её до ума бесит. Пора взбодрить разработчиков. | This is a rare case of a game I actually sometimes play but can't recommend, for some very simple reasons.  Why can't you connect pieces to each other?  Why can't you change the cut of puzzles?  Why is the DLC, which must be nearly no cost to "develop," so expensive per image?  And WHY, if all the game does is puzzles, do the images seem to have no thought behind them as to what makes an image fun to assemble?

In summary, why would I invest in a bunch of DLC when someone could easily put a better jigsaw puzzle game on Steam and I literally would have no reason to ever come back to this mediocre option again...

...and now I think someone did.  I'm going to check out Super Jigsaw Puzzle: Generations.

Anyway, play the three Animated Jigsaws games instead.  They are fantastic. | [h1]重要的事放前面，成就狂魔千万不要玩这个游戏！！！[/h1]
----下面开始正文，我是在买Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime的时候发现库里多了这个游戏，什么意思呢，就是我花钱买的啊~其实就是这代游戏的DLC被拆开来单独卖了，而且还比DLC的还贵！我不信我掉落的卡牌之类能回本回个8块钱的差价[spoiler]我又不是欧洲人张张都是闪卡[/spoiler]
----[u] 重点来了[/u]，为什么成就狂魔不要玩，我点开成就就懵了，743个成就！不算各种使用道具之类的成就居然还有上百个拼好一个拼图给一个的成就！！问题是你的好多拼图全在DLC里面要买啊，我还要为了全成就买全DLC?下面另起一段继续。
----每个DLC各一种类别的拼图，每个人自然有喜欢的不喜欢的，强行全拼完才能全成就简直过分。更何况我仔细看过，拼图的图片画质其实有些模糊，感觉就像随便找的图做成的关卡。
----开始觉得很新奇，玩了两局。后来才发现问题，[u]玩这个真的是太伤眼睛了[/u]，所以我早早的放弃了这个游戏。
    [h1]保护眼睛，少玩！[/h1]
----看到人一定要帮顶啊，不要再有人不小心入坑了！
 [h1]更新评测，该游戏DLC高产似母猪，成就简直无穷无尽！！[/h1]
----再次更新，实在无法忍受成就与日俱增，这个游戏将成为我第一个移除的游戏，走吧您诶。

Sadly, and I cannot believe that these games get onto the store, but the game is just a bit broken.
Saves do not always save, and there is no way to bypass the intro screens later on.
Developer has not responded to issues for years, not worth the trouble. 

A pity, because the game does work, story is interesting ,but it's abandoned and janky.

Such a great point & click game. I finally got around playing this game since I bought it a decade ago (2016 I just checked my purchase history!). I'll start by saying this game has a strong narrative and not so convoluted puzzles. Not once did I feel like having to randomly combine items to progress or trying to solve some mind-boggling puzzles that required me to look up a guide. The story was creepy and full of lore and great characters. The voice acting was superb (Jim Sterling voiced this!), plus the game allows you to manually save in case you're one of those achievement hunters. There's supposedly a sequel to this game with how they ended it but it's currently stuck in a development hell for years, plus the developer himself is sick in real life. So let's pray and hope for the best... | Story was okay. Probably could have skipped the very short middle story, it didn't add much. Had enough of the inventory collecting and puzzles of where to put something to make it a quick P&C romp. Get it on sale for sure. | I enjoyed this horror-themed point-and-click adventure game.  It consists of three chapters that each take about an hour to complete.  The puzzles are VERY straightforward, so I wouldn't recommend it for people who are looking for a challenge.  But the story is creepy (especially the third chapter) and the voice acting is above average.   Overall the game is quite engaging and its a nice way to spend an afternoon.  It ends with a cliffhanger, and the sequel was never released, so skip this one if you want closure.  Definitely worth it if you get it on sale.  6/10. | pixel grafik point click bulmaca hikaye 3 farklı hikaye mevcut ortalama bir yapım | Very interesting game with weird twists - as much as I had no idea where it was going, I loved this game! [h1]Unexpected Gem[/h1]
[b]Key features[/b]
[list]
[*]Deep and complex crafting system,
[*]Cool finish moves,
[*]Unnecessary experience grind for skills and buildings
[/list]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3401267474
[b]Lots of fun moments[/b]
Honestly, I didn't expect much from this game. I knew it was old and thought it would be a few days trip. Ha. Haha! 
I ended up running in cities, collecting tinned food and moving heavy garbage containers. I had to hunt zombified animals in swamps and lure unique trophies into specific areas. 
Days turned into nights, when more dangerous species attacked my so recklessly built camp, which led into another adventure (read - vacuuming all visible resources!) and extremely careful preparation for further defences. 

[b]I survived![/b]
There were so many NPCs, sending my to find rare samples and their friends. Seemingly easy missions quickly turned into skills test (I played solo). I found out that multiple zombies could run and my melee attacks often were a bit slow. So I obtained some guns. The shooting noise, however, attracted more infected =/ And then there were quick zombified dogs, acid pelicans, bloody crocodiles! Nasty beings.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3414544819

[b]How to Survive 2 got me 80hrs+ and I mostly enjoyed it. 
Few stupid mechanics annoyed the hell out of me e.g. inability to rotate camera - very often enemies are hidden by a wall or an object. Or my character would do a spinning melee attack instead of a straight hit and miss a zombie. Plus, when running, your character will do a parcour over a chair or car, instead of just "rubbing and running along it".

But generally, lots of positive vibes. Various quests, complex crafting for melee/range weapons AND enhancing medicaments. Moreover, there's a cooking system with more buffs and extra side-effects. 
If you decide to try this game, it's very likely that you'll be grasped by it for many days.[/b] | 開始３０分後
僕はピッチフォーク投げの強さに気付き、ひたすらピッチフォークをゾンビに投げつけていた

A ideia do jogo não né ruim, mas a jogabilidade é horrível. O jogo é lento demais e você não consegue encurtar tarefas repetitivas. As lutas são repetitivas e lentas demais, exigem muitos cliques para dar os comandos e depois de algum tempo jogando você se lembra que tem uma vida e não dá pra perde-la jogando qualquer porcaria. | игра хорошая. выживалка с выбором как же я долго этого ждал) 5 часов играю  не могу оторваться | Yes, but... 

Take it for what it is. A low budget game made by a small team. It's fun for a couple of hours, despite of plenty of quirks. I felt plenty of times that "I wish I have known this before I took this decision" and by "this" I mean a pretty important mechanic that you build your character around. One such example is that you can't go on quests without your main character, hence he can't stay behind and heal. 

Also ludonarrative dissonance (you know, when the gameplay is contradicting the narrative, just as no way of resurrecting a character that dies during a cutscene in FFVII in spite of pheonix down) is very frequent. Among other things, in this game I had to waste a very valuable medkit on a fully healed character because of narrative reasons. | An RPG that is fun enough to be worth your money if you get it on a sale. It has some UI that's unclear and the missions are not also sometimes unclear but fun enough that I enjoyed it nonetheless.

I believe in enjoying a game so here's some quick tips of how to get around better if you decide to get this game (small spoilers on game-play and missions):

First, the missions are all done via inviting the person to join your party and then going to the mission area normally. For example: 
 - Jamal's mission to take him hunting in the woods is done by inviting him to your party and then going into the woods where you will hunt deer via small event popups. NOT putting him and the player on the job for hunting.

Second, for Lydia's mission, note that you must take her to a SPECIFIC diner (which I believe resides at 10/20 on the Highway (Day) map. NOT the small diner events you see in between. (Hence why I said there is some missions which are unclear)

Third, this is just a tip for enjoying the early game, Melee is very important to level to 3 ASAP as breakthrough is one of the few skills that reduce enemy armor, and Melee also don't cost ammo.

Fourth, healing is doable in combat when you get to Medic level 3, and YOU CANNOT HEAL YOURSELF, so plan to have at least two people with medic 3 if you need to heal.

Fifth, healing requires "medical supplies", engineering traps require "engineering supplies", and guns require "ammo", melee is the only thing that is always free. Plan your supplies accordingly.

Overall a hearty recommend, I enjoyed the game, thank you for letting us date certain characters as well, really liked that. I wish there was a way to avoid a specific event as it seems less reasonable that the event pops up even when certain criteria are not fulfilled. Would love to have this event be more dynamic, like it triggers if you fail to have enough resources or make a specific choice instead of this person will always betray you, just let them die.

Dead State (A game I also really like) also had this issue. There were certain characters you were better off not finding as they are guaranteed to lead to difficult events, and since this was unavoidable, the best thing to do is to never deal with those characters, which I felt decreases the immersion in the story in that game as well.

If you liked this game you may like Dead State as well. | merhaba arkadaşlar burak bullydenin ilk bölümüne hoşgeldiniz bugün sizlerle yeni serimiz bullye başlıyoruz arkadaşlar çok fazla istediniz hadi
